The system should check the discretized functional inputs to ensure that the current working conditions are properly considered at different working stages and states, avoiding calculation errors caused by ignoring stages or states.

requirement: The longitudinal control during landing run is the same as that of take-off ground segment.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the sequence, timing, and hardware coordination of landing rollout and takeoff ground segment control are consistent, and that the control conditions are complete and the logic is conflict-free. Safety is a priority.

The entry and exit conditions of each mode should be consistent in the control of landing rollout and take-off ground segment, so as to avoid abnormal mode switching caused by condition conflicts. Safety is a key concern in this process.

The control logic timing, constraints, concurrency, and combination relationships between the functional points of landing rollout and take-off ground segment should meet the design requirements to prevent control conflicts or omissions. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

After the system power failure recovery or reset of runaway flight, it should be able to automatically restore to the normal control state of landing run or take-off ground segment and maintain continuity. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The timing of outputting the landing rollout and takeoff ground segment control states must strictly match the current flight scenario requirements to ensure the real-time effectiveness of the control commands. Safety is a priority in this process.

requirement: In the lateral control during landing rollout, yg is linearly reduced from -δx 0 / Ky to 0 within 2 seconds.
safety_requirements: The system should be set with a timeout judgment mechanism to ensure that the lateral control of landing rollout completes the linear reduction of yg to 0 within 2 seconds. If it is not completed within the timeout, abnormal processing will be triggered. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should conduct validity checks on parameters such as δx and Ky in the control calculation results to ensure the correctness of the calculation results under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum and minimum values.

The system should continuously monitor the duration of the lateral control task during landing rollout, and when the task execution time is less than the specified threshold, initiate the redundant validation process. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
The system should implement a check for the validity of the divisor during data processing and prohibit the execution of division operations when the Ky parameter is zero, ensuring Safety.

The system should set a reasonable range limit for the rate of change of the yg parameter, and initiate a correction or alarm mechanism for abnormal data exceeding the preset upper or lower slope limit. Safety is enhanced through such mechanisms.

requirement: In the lateral control during landing rollout, yg (k) = Kyg (Kz . Dz (k) + Kz . Dz (k) - K . Δy(k) - K . wy (k)) + 0.5yg 0, where yg 0 is the outer loop control quantity of the rudder channel at the end of the roll leveling segment.
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time verification of the lateral control calculation result for landing rollout, yg(k), to ensure that it meets the control logic requirements under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should validate the input parameters Kyg, Kz, Dz(k), Δy(k), wy(k) based on the current working phase and flight status to ensure that no abnormal conditions have occurred which are not considered in terms of working phase or working status. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should ensure that the timing of control calculations is strictly synchronized with hardware operations, and the control conditions must remain complete without any logical conflicts. Safety is critical in this process.

The system needs to verify the temporal relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combinational condition logic correctness among various parameters (Kyg, Kz, Dz(k), Δy(k), wy(k)).

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the rate of parameter changes to ensure that the slope of changes in key parameters such as Kyg and Kz are within the set upper and lower limits. When the range is exceeded, a preset processing strategy should be executed. Safety is crucial in this process.

requirement: During the in-flight engine start process, the throttle control follows the start procedure. After a successful in-flight engine start, the aircraft exits the drop phase and transitions to the corresponding phase, with the throttle control following the corresponding phase control; if the in-flight engine start fails, the throttle position is set to 0%. This ensures Safety.
safety_requirements: During the in-flight engine start process, the system should conduct real-time verification of throttle control input parameters based on the current operating phase and status to ensure that incorrect control logic will not be executed when the operating phase or status is not taken into account. This measure enhances Safety.

The system should perform boundary and abnormal value detection on the calculation results of engine air start control. When the throttle control command appears an illegal value other than 0% or an out-of-limit value, it should immediately trigger an alarm and enter Safety mode.

The system should automatically check the current engine status after the software power failure and restart. If it is in the air start process, it needs to recover to the nearest Safety status point, ensuring that the throttle position is forcibly set to 0% when there is no recovery or incorrect recovery.

The system should set up a timeout monitoring mechanism for the engine air start control calculation. When the calculation is not completed within the specified time, the throttle position should be automatically set to 0% and record the abnormal event to ensure Safety.

After power recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should gradually restore the throttle control function after confirming the engine status through self-test to ensure that the throttle position remains within a safe range during the recovery process Safety

requirement: When autonomous control does not achieve satisfactory results, manual correction control can be used to make minor adjustments to the autonomous control. The correction amount enters the flight control computer via three remote control stick channels (elevator control amount, aileron control amount, rudder control amount) and airspeed correction combination commands, and after corresponding proportional conversion, it is incorporated into the control law, thereby achieving the purpose of correcting the control effect. The significance of the correction items varies at different flight stages. Safety is a key concern throughout all processes.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the manually entered correction takes into account the current flight phase and operating status, ensuring that the control calculation process correctly applies the corresponding algorithm, thereby guaranteeing Safety.

The system should check the results of the control calculations to ensure that under normal, abnormal, boundary, and extreme minimum/maximum values, the processing results of the correction meet the Safety requirements and trigger corresponding alarm or limitation mechanisms.

The system should monitor the response time of the control calculation process, and if the result is not returned within the specified time, then execute the preset Safety strategy (such as using the default value or switching the control mode).

The system should detect the current flight status and restore it to the correct working state after a power failure restart, ensuring the continuity and accuracy of subsequent control calculations. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure that the sending sequence and timing of manual correction control instructions are coordinated with the hardware system, and verify the completeness and consistency of control conditions to avoid control conflicts or failures. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: Different manual corrections are required for the control corresponding to each flight phase, and the relationship between manual correction and manipulation is linear.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the current working phase and flight status to ensure that the linear correspondence between manual correction and control is only effective in the corresponding flight phase, avoiding misuse of parameters across phases, thus enhancing Safety.

The system should ensure that the timing and sequence of control calculations are coordinated with the hardware interface, and prohibit the execution of related operations when the control conditions are incomplete or conflicting. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the rate of change of manual correction, ensure that it is within the preset upper and lower limits of the slope range, and implement predefined processing strategies for data exceeding the slope. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should check the timing, constraints, concurrency, and combination relationships between the control logics of each functional point to ensure that the logic is coordinated and conflict-free. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should validate the control calculation results to ensure they are valid and normal, and trigger a safety handling mechanism for unexpected results such as abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values.

requirement: When switching between remote control mode and the mode with an inner loop, record the old values of the given attitude angles (roll, yaw, and pitch) before the switch as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: When the system switches between in-band loop and remote control modes, it should check the changes in the values of functional interface data to ensure that the old recorded values of the given attitude angles (roll, yaw, pitch) accurately reflect the actual state before the switch. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should verify the transition conditions for remote control mode switching in the software state space to ensure that the transition conditions are effectively set and satisfiable, preventing attitude control anomalies caused by illegal state transitions. Safety must be prioritized throughout this process.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the operating status of external devices (such as sensors, NVM). When it detects that the device is in an abnormal state such as power-off or initialization, it should suspend mode switching and record the abnormal status information to ensure Safety.

The system should validate the old values of the given attitude angle calculated. When abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values appear, the alarm mechanism should be triggered and illegal mode switching should be prevented. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure that the timing for recording the old value of the given attitude angle before switching is strictly synchronized with the remote control mode switching operation, and meets the predefined switching scenario sequence requirements. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

requirement: The control law used for manual correction is the same as the automatic control law (Equation 2-1, Equation 2-2, Equation 2-3), with only the correction amount added to the corresponding control quantity.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the timing coordination between manual correction control and hardware, the control conditions need to be complete and consistent before and after, and logical conflicts should be avoided. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should conduct status and operation phase checks on the manually corrected control inputs to ensure proper handling when the working status or phase is not considered, thereby guaranteeing Safety.

The system should verify the rationality of the results of manual correction control calculations, including the correctness of processing for normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum/minimum values. Safety is also a concern in this process.

The system should conduct a timeout monitoring on the process of artificial correction control calculation. When the result is not returned within the specified time, the safety processing mechanism should be triggered.

The system should ensure the correctness and conflict-free operation of the timing, constraints, concurrency, and combination relationships between manual correction control and other functional point control logics. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: Command control mode is a control mode in which the flight status or position of the aircraft is changed by command control according to the actual situation during the cruise process of the aircraft.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the functional inputs take into account the current working phase and flight status under the command control mode to ensure that the control calculation process matches the actual status, and trigger the safety handling mechanism when the relevant conditions are not considered.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the status entry conditions for the instruction control mode to ensure that the status execution results meet expectations when the conditions are met, not met, or met again. It should also initiate status verification or alarms in abnormal situations. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should set up a timeout monitoring mechanism for the control calculation process of the instruction control mode. When the calculation does not return results within the specified time, the current operation should be terminated immediately and the preset Safety response measures should be executed.

The system needs to verify the consistency between the software status and the actual system status, working phase, and task requirements under instruction control mode, and should suspend control operations and record abnormalities when inconsistencies are found. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

After the system restarts due to a software power loss, it should check the status recovery of the instruction control mode to ensure that a status reset or Safety mode switch is triggered when there is no recovery or an incorrect recovery.

requirement: The control law structure under the autonomous control mode is not changed by the command control mode.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control law structure under instruction control mode is coordinated with the hardware control timing and sequence, the control conditions are complete, and the front and rear states maintain consistency. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.

After the system performs hardware control, it should continuously monitor and determine whether the actual hardware status matches the control requirements under the instruction control mode in terms of Safety.

The system should check the entry conditions of states without transfer relationships to ensure that state execution complies with the instruction control mode requirements under circumstances such as 'simultaneously satisfied' or 'satisfied during execution'. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should establish a timeout judgment mechanism for critical control operations. When the hardware status has not met the requirements of the instruction control mode for a long time, an exception handling process should be triggered. Safety is a crucial consideration in this design.

The system should check the functional inputs under the instruction control mode according to the current working status and phase, to ensure that the control law structure calculation process correctly handles the input parameters of different working phases and statuses. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The instruction control class instructions for setting have lateral directions.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of instruction control class instructions are coordinated with hardware, and the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after.

After the system executes the instruction control type instruction, it should monitor and determine the matching of hardware status with control requirements, and trigger an alarm or corrective action when a mismatch is found. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should evaluate the validity of the lateral command parameters set by personnel. For abnormal parameters, the system should either alert the user or not respond at all. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure the correctness of timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combinational relationships among the control logics of each functional point. Safety must be guaranteed.

The system should make a rationality judgment based on the current equipment status before issuing potentially hazardous lateral control commands or actions, and prevent the execution of irrational commands. This process is crucial for Safety.

requirement: Supports instruction control modes such as "left circling", "right circling", "figure-8 flying", "temporary waypoint", and longitudinal "fixed height", "altitude setting", as well as speed control modes like "constant speed" and "speed setting".
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the inputs of each control mode meet the requirements of the current working phase and status, ensuring that related instructions are not executed without considering the working phase or status, thereby guaranteeing Safety.

The system should real-time monitor the working status consistency of redundancy. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should synchronize the states or trigger the exception handling mechanism.
The system should verify whether the timing, constraints, concurrency, and combination relationships between control modes conform to the design logic, ensuring conflict-free execution Safety.

The system should ensure that the timing of the control mode output accurately matches the requirements of the current flight scenario, and when deviating from the scenario conditions, it should trigger a warning or suppress the output to ensure Safety.

requirement: Under autonomous control or command control mode, sending any of the above instructions between climbing segment 2 and completing the route to cut into the final approach (exclusive) can switch to command control mode.
safety_requirements: The system should check the input instructions for entering the command control mode at different working stages and states, ensuring that the instructions are only responded to when the current segment is between the second stage of climb and the completion of the route before joining the final approach (exclusive). Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should validate the results of the control calculations for validity. When abnormal values, boundary values, or out-of-range inputs are detected, mode switching should be prohibited and the exception handling mechanism should be triggered. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

After the system restarts due to a software power loss, it should recover to a Safety state or autonomous control mode, and recheck the conditions of the current segment and control mode to ensure the correctness of the mode switching.

The system should continuously monitor the entry conditions of the command control mode, prohibit mode switching when the conditions are not met, and re-evaluate the switching request when the conditions are met again. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should ensure that the timing of switching to the instruction control mode meets the requirements of the specified segment and scenario conditions, avoiding mode switching during unexpected time periods or segments. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: In segment 1 of the climb, only the "constant speed" and "airspeed setting" commands are valid; all other commands are invalid.
safety_requirements: The system should evaluate the validity of the instructions received during the climb phase, only allowing 'constant speed' and 'airspeed setting' instructions to take effect. All other instructions should be rejected and trigger an exception prompt. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for critical control instructions. When the hardware status does not meet the control requirements within the specified time, the instruction execution should be automatically terminated and enter the Safety state.

The system should continuously monitor the task duration of Segment 1 climb. When the task duration is detected to be less than the specified threshold, it is necessary to verify the correctness of the functional processing logic and record abnormal events.

The system should ensure that the execution sequence and timing of control instructions for the 1-segment climb phase are coordinated with hardware device operations. The control conditions must maintain completeness and logical consistency before and after. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

When the system processes instructions for phase 1 of the climb, it should verify in real-time the current working phase and status information, and intercept and record abnormal inputs that do not take into account the current working phase or status. Safety is crucial during this process.

requirement: Under the instruction control mode, the same type of instruction can be resent, and the new instruction will replace the old one.
safety_requirements: When the system reissues instructions of the same type under instruction control mode, it should check the current working phase and status to ensure that the processing of new instructions replacing old ones meets the requirements of the current phase and status. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should verify the execution status of the instruction replacement function before and after the state transition, ensuring that the replacement operation of the new instruction will not cause functional interruption or abnormal execution during the state transition process. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should ensure that the timing of instruction replacement control is coordinated with hardware operations, ensuring that the execution order and timing after the new instruction replaces the old one meet the hardware coordination requirements. Safety.

The system should perform conflict detection on the functional points to be executed simultaneously, ensuring that after a new instruction replaces an old one, conflicting operation instructions will not be generated for the same execution mechanism. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for critical control instructions. If the hardware status does not reach the expected state for a long time after a new instruction replaces the old one, corresponding processing measures should be triggered. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: When under the control of the "fixed height" command, the given height in the flight control law is taken as the flight altitude at the moment the "fixed height" command is received.
safety_requirements: The system should verify whether the entry conditions for the altitude-holding instruction are met, and ensure that the given altitude is maintained at the height value when the instruction is received when the conditions change (such as being met again or not being met), to prevent abnormal execution of the status. The Safety of the system must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should ensure that the calculation sequence of control laws is coordinated with the hardware operation timing, the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after, and avoid high-degree control failure caused by timing issues. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should check the current working stage and status, and under the fixed altitude mode, ensure that it is not interfered by other working stages or statuses, and correctly adopt the height value at the instruction time as the given altitude. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should ensure that the output timing of the control status under the fixed-height mode conforms to the flight scenario requirements, and timely adjust the control law parameters to maintain the given height. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.

The system should monitor the timeout of the set-height command execution. If the hardware status does not reach the control target for a long time (such as excessive height deviation), the Safety protection mechanism should be triggered (such as alarm or switching to backup mode).

requirement: When controlled by the "altitude setting" command, the specified altitude in the flight control law is taken as the set altitude value. Safety
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the control law calculation results under the instruction control of height setting, to ensure that the processing results are correct and effective when the normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, maximum value and minimum value appear.

The system should ensure that the control timing of the height setting instructions is strictly synchronized with the hardware devices, and the control conditions should cover all working states and maintain logical consistency. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should validate the input parameters of the height setting function during the status phase to prevent control calculation errors caused by not considering the current working status or phase. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should continuously compare the output data of different redundancy height settings. When the deviation between redundant outputs exceeds a preset threshold, the redundant processing mechanism should be triggered and the anomaly should be recorded. Safety is ensured throughout this process.

Before issuing altitude setting control commands, the system should verify the rationality of the commands based on the actual operating status of the current equipment, avoiding the output of hazardous commands that may trigger system risks, thereby ensuring Safety.

requirement: When switching between inner-loop remote control and non-inner-loop remote control modes, record the old value of the rudder deflection command before the switch as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: When the system switches between in-band loop and remote control modes without an inner loop, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and verify that the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

When the system switches modes, it should check whether the old value of the rudder deflection command conforms to the requirements of the current working phase and status, avoiding processing errors caused by failure to consider the working phase or status. Safety is crucial in this process.

When the system switches modes, a timeout judgment should be set for the key operation of recording the old value of the rudder bias command to prevent the hardware status from not meeting the control requirements for a long time. This ensures Safety.

The system should verify the old value of the rudder deflection command obtained from the control calculation to ensure that it is a valid value, and correctly handle abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum and minimum values. Safety must also be considered in this process.

The system should verify whether the old value of the rudder deflection command before switching has been correctly restored after a power failure and software reboot, to prevent incorrect execution caused by the state not being restored or incorrectly restored. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The given altitude in the autonomous control mode is the altitude of the target waypoint.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the correctness of the timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships of the control logic for each functional point under the autonomous control mode, ensuring that the target waypoint altitude setting is coordinated with relevant functions. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system must ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, the control conditions are complete and consistent, so as to correctly set the target waypoint altitude under the autonomous control mode. Safety is a key consideration in this process.

The system should check the results of the control calculations (including target waypoint altitudes) to ensure that the function processing is correct under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum/minimum values. Safety must also be ensured during this process.

The system should check whether the functional inputs take into account the current working phase and status to prevent errors in the target waypoint altitude caused by not considering the working phase or status. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should implement a timeout judgment mechanism for critical control actions (such as target waypoint altitude adjustment) to handle situations where the hardware status does not meet control requirements for an extended period. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: Under the command control mode, the navigation algorithm or waypoint switching method can be changed according to the command, but the control law is the same as that of autonomous control.
safety_requirements: The system should check the current working phase and status under command control mode to ensure that the changes in navigation algorithm or waypoint switching will not affect the consistency of control law and autonomous control. Safety is also a key concern in this process.

The system should verify the sequence and timing of the control process under the instruction control mode and the coordination with the hardware, ensuring that the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the control calculation results under instruction control mode, and implement corresponding safety handling mechanisms for different situations such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values.

The system should verify the correctness of the timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships of the control logic for each functional point under the instruction control mode. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should perform a timeout detection on the control calculation process under instruction control mode, and initiate the safety emergency handling mechanism when the result is not returned within the specified time.

requirement: The specified airspeed in the flight control law is taken as the airspeed value at the moment the "constant speed" command is received when under "constant speed" command control.
safety_requirements: The system should check the control calculation results of the flight control law. When the airspeed value is normal, abnormal, boundary or extreme value, it should ensure the correctness of the given airspeed under the speed command and take corresponding processing measures. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should validate the functional inputs to ensure that the control calculation process correctly considers the current phase and status at different working stages and statuses, avoiding incorrect airspeed values due to lack of consideration. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the status entry conditions for the set-speed instruction. When the entry conditions are met, not met, or met again, it should ensure the correctness of status execution, such as starting, pausing, or reapplying the set-speed control. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of the control law are coordinated with hardware operations, and verify the completeness and consistency of control conditions to avoid abnormal airspeed values caused by timing conflicts. Safety is a priority.

The system should monitor the timeout of the control calculation process. If the result is not returned within the specified time, the backup processing mechanism will be triggered to ensure the reliability of the airspeed value under the fixed speed instruction. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The specified airspeed in the flight control law is taken as the set airspeed value when "Speed Setting" is selected.
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the control calculation results for the given airspeed in the flight control law, ensure that they are within the normal value range, and trigger corresponding fault-tolerant processing mechanisms for abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum or minimum values. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should validate the input airspeed value of the 'speed setting' function according to the current working phase and flight status, and prohibit directly using the set value without considering the working phase or status. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system must ensure that the timing of airspeed calculation in the control law is strictly synchronized with hardware execution, and the control conditions should cover all possible operating scenarios with consistent logic. Safety is a priority.

The system should continuously monitor the entry conditions of the 'speed setting' status, and initiate the airspeed setting function when the conditions are met. The function should be immediately stopped or the set value re-validated when the conditions are not met or met again. Safety is a priority in all operations.

The system needs to define the timing priority and constraint relationships between airspeed settings in the flight control laws and other functional points (such as altitude control, thrust adjustment), ensuring that the logic is conflict-free during concurrent operations and the combined results meet expectations. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

requirement: The specified airspeed in the flight control law is a value stored in the flight control computer, calculated based on flight performance during autonomous control. Safety is crucial in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the control calculation results for the given airspeed in the flight control law, ensuring correct processing under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, while also recording abnormalities. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should conduct status and operation phase compatibility checks on the control calculation process for the given airspeed, ensuring that input parameters at different phases and statuses are consistent with the current flight mode. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should set a time limit for the control calculation process in response to the given airspeed. If the result is not returned within the specified time, a timeout alarm should be triggered and the backup processing mechanism should be activated. The Safety of the system must be ensured throughout this process.

The system should ensure that the control commands for the given airspeed are strictly synchronized with the timing and sequence of hardware execution, and verify the completeness and consistency of the control conditions Safety.

For critical control actions (such as airspeed adjustment), the system should set up a timeout monitoring mechanism to terminate in time and enter Safety mode when the hardware status does not meet expectations.

requirement: The airspeed setting limit is (25m/s, 65m/s).
safety_requirements: The system should clearly define the lower and upper limits of the airspeed sensor's acquisition range, and trigger a sensor fault alarm when the airspeed exceeds (25m/s, 65m/s).

The system should set a timeout judgment mechanism for airspeed control actions. When the airspeed exceeds the amplitude limit range of (25m/s, 65m/s) for a long time, safety protection measures should be activated immediately.

The system should conduct validity checks on the results of airspeed control calculations to ensure that the processing of different cases, including normal values, abnormal values, boundary values (25m/s and 65m/s), and extreme values, complies with safety logic requirements.

The system should ensure that the sending sequence and timing of airspeed control commands are coordinated with the response characteristics of the actuator hardware, and the control conditions must be fully consistent with the flight status.

The system should set up an over-limit processing strategy for airspeed output. When the calculated value exceeds (25m/s, 65m/s), it should be automatically truncated to the corresponding limit value and record the abnormal event.

requirement: When sending the "cancel altitude hold" command, exit the control of "altitude hold" or "altitude setting" command, and take the given altitude as the target waypoint altitude
safety_requirements: The system should set a timeout judgment mechanism after sending the "cancel set altitude" instruction to ensure that the exit from the set altitude/altitude control status is completed within the specified time. If it is not completed within the timeout, then trigger Safety protection measures.

When the system exits the fixed-height or altitude setting control state, it should check the integrity and validity of the function interface data values to ensure that the given altitude accurately switches to the target waypoint altitude. Safety is a priority in all operations.

The system should set a secure threshold range for the output data's Safety. When the calculated target waypoint altitude exceeds the threshold, data truncation should be performed or switch to a preset safe altitude value.

Before the system issues the "cancel set altitude" command, it should continuously verify the matching of the current equipment status with the target waypoint altitude. It is prohibited to perform altitude switching operations when safety conditions are not met.

The system should verify the interface data sampling time for the "Cancel Altitude Hold" command to ensure that the input data is neither earlier than the current flight status nor later than the requirement of the target waypoint. Safety is a priority in this process.

requirement: When sending the "Cancel Speed Setting" command, exit from the control of the "Cruise" or "Speed Setting" command, and the given speed value is the same as that of the autonomous control. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism. After sending the "cancel constant speed" command, if the hardware status does not exit the constant speed or speed setting control within the specified time, a timeout alarm should be triggered and safety measures should be taken.

The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of the "cruise cancel" command are coordinated with the hardware status, and that the control conditions are complete and the logic is consistent.
The system should clearly define the entry and exit conditions for each control mode (constant speed, speed setting, autonomous control), and ensure the consistency of the conditional logic.

When the system executes the "cruise cancel" command, it should check the current working status and phase to ensure that the control calculation process meets the requirements of the current status Safety.

The system should ensure that the timing of the control status output for the "cruise cancel" command meets the requirements of the current scenario, ensuring that the given speed and autonomous control values are updated synchronously. Safety is a priority in all operations.

requirement: When sending the "resume course" command, exit the lateral command control and cut into the original course from the current position to the point.
safety_requirements: After power failure reset or runaway reset, the system should restore the state after sending the 'resume course' command and ensure the correctness of exiting lateral instruction control and resuming the original course function. Safety is critical in this process.

After the transmitting end resumes data transmission, the receiving end should be able to correctly receive and process the 'resume course' command, ensuring the normal execution of the function to exit lateral command control and resume course interception.

When switching redundancy, the system should ensure that the output values for exiting lateral command control and re-entering the original route during the execution of the 'recovery route' instruction remain correct to avoid anomalies. Safety must be a priority throughout this process.

The system should check the status after executing the 'resume route' command following a power loss and restart of the software to ensure that the lateral command control is correctly exited and the route re-entry function is restored properly, avoiding any status errors. This measure guarantees Safety.

The system should ensure the correct temporal, constraint, concurrent, and combinational relationships between the "resume route" command and other functional control logics to avoid functional execution failure caused by timing errors. Safety must be guaranteed.

requirement: "The 'Cancel Altitude Hold', 'Cancel Speed Hold', and 'Resume Route' commands are only valid under the command control mode after the corresponding entry command has been sent."
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to power loss, it should check if it has entered the command control mode; otherwise, the execution of the "Cancel Altitude Hold", "Cancel Speed Hold", and "Resume Route" commands shall be prohibited.

The system should conduct real-time verification of the execution conditions for the "cancel altitude hold", "cancel speed hold", and "resume route" commands to ensure that execution is only allowed when the command control mode has been activated and the corresponding entry command exists Safety.

The system should re-validate the execution conditions of the "cancel altitude setting", "cancel speed setting", and "resume route" commands after an interface data communication interruption or reconnection to ensure they conform to the current working status and phase. Safety must be ensured during this process.

The system should validate the effectiveness of the control calculations for the commands "cancel altitude hold", "cancel speed hold", and "resume route" to ensure they are within the predefined Safety range.

The system should set a timeout detection for the execution process of the "cancel altitude hold", "cancel speed hold", and "resume route" commands. If the set time is exceeded without completion, then the safety mechanism will be triggered.

requirement: Record the old value of the throttle bias instruction before the conversion when there is a phase transition or a control mode switch related to the remote control mode, as the softening starting point.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the old value of the recorded throttle bias instruction is a normal value, abnormal value, boundary value, or maximum/minimum value when switching phases or remote control modes, and ensure that it is handled correctly in different cases to guarantee Safety.

The system should verify the value and change range of the old throttle bias command during phase conversion or remote control mode switching, ensuring its consistency with the current state and the state before conversion. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should conduct input checks when recording the old values of the throttle valve bias command, based on the current working phase and status, to ensure that no status or phase information is omitted. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should check the recording status of the old value of the throttle bias instruction after a power loss restart to ensure its correct recovery and usability for the calculation of the softening starting point.

The system should ensure that the control sequence for recording the old value of the throttle bias command is coordinated with hardware operations during phase transition or remote control mode switching, avoiding data inconsistency caused by sequence conflicts. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: After the "cancel altitude hold", "cancel speed hold", and "resume route" commands are effectively processed, the control mode will only return to autonomous control when the command control state is exited in all three aspects: longitudinal, lateral, and speed. Otherwise, the command control mode will be maintained. Safety is a priority in all operations.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to a power loss, it should check the processing status of the "Cancel Altitude Hold," "Cancel Speed Hold," and "Resume Route" commands, as well as the situation regarding the exit instruction control states for longitudinal, lateral, and velocity aspects, ensuring that the control mode correctly restores to autonomous control or maintains the command control mode. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should check the processing input of commands such as "cancel fixed height" to ensure that the current working status and phase are considered, avoiding abnormal switching of control modes caused by failure to consider the working phase or status. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should validate the results of the control calculations, considering normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum/minimum values to ensure that autonomous control mode is only restored when instructions for longitudinal, lateral, and velocity control are all disengaged. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should set a timeout judgment mechanism for the processing of key instructions such as "cancel set altitude" to prevent abnormal switching of control modes when the hardware status does not meet the control requirements for a long time. This mechanism enhances Safety.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of control mode switching are coordinated with the hardware, the control conditions are complete and consistent, and avoid abnormal control modes caused by timing conflicts or missing conditions. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The remote control mode is divided into two types: remote control with an inner loop and remote control without an inner loop.
safety_requirements: When the system switches between remote control modes (with or without an inner loop), it should check the current working stage and status to ensure that the control calculation process matches the mode type, avoiding processing errors caused by failure to consider the working stage or status. Safety is a priority during this process.

The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of the remote control mode switching are consistent with the hardware system, and the control conditions are complete and conflict-free. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should conduct real-time verification of the calculation results under remote control mode (such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum/minimum values) to ensure that the functional processing is correct under different input conditions. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should verify the correctness of the control logic timing, constraint relationships, concurrent operations, and combination modes between the in-band loop remote control and the non-in-band loop remote control modes. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should conduct a timeout monitoring on the decoding process of the remote control mode. If the decoding is not completed within the specified time, a warning should be triggered or it should switch to Safety mode.

requirement: The remote control directly controls the control surfaces (elevator, aileron, and rudder) without an inner loop, and performs an appropriate proportional conversion of the remote control operation quantity.
safety_requirements: The system should check the stage and status information when the remote control input is entered, to ensure that the control surface control calculation process matches the current status under different states and stages. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system must verify that the timing of the control instruction output strictly conforms to the hardware interface requirements, ensuring the coordination of control sequence and timing. Safety is a critical concern in this process.

The system should validate the effectiveness of the calculated control surface deflection, including checks for normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values to ensure that the output results meet Safety range requirements.

The system should real-time monitor the working status consistency of each redundancy. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different working statuses, it should trigger the status synchronization mechanism or switch to the main redundancy control.

requirement: The in-band loop remote control converts the remote control quantity into the corresponding given attitude angle, and through the autonomous control laws (equations (2-1), (2-2), and (2-3)), it calculates the corresponding rudder deflection control commands to control the control surfaces.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the process of remote control quantity conversion and control law calculation considers the current working stage and status, ensuring that the rudder deflection control command generation is consistent with the actual status to guarantee Safety.

The system should conduct validity verification on the rudder deflection control instructions calculated, including real-time detection and processing of normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum/minimum values. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should ensure that the timing of rudder deflection control command generation is strictly synchronized with the hardware execution timing, and maintain the completeness and consistency of control conditions. Safety must also be considered in this process.

The system should set up a timeout monitoring mechanism for the control calculation process. When the calculation is not completed within the specified time, it should trigger an alternative control strategy or Safety shutdown

The system should verify the timing relationships, constraints, and correctness of concurrent operations between each control logic module to prevent conflicts or combination errors in control instructions. Safety is ensured through this process.

requirement: The remote control of the throttle is the same under the two remote modes.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the sequence, timing, and hardware coordination of the control valve under two remote control modes, and maintain the integrity and consistency of the control conditions. Safety is also a key consideration in this process.
The system should verify that the entry and exit conditions for the two remote control modes remain consistent, preventing logical conflicts during mode switching. Safety is crucial in this process.

After the system performs throttle control in two remote control modes, it should conduct real-time monitoring of the hardware status and control requirements, and trigger an alarm or correction mechanism when there is a mismatch. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should check whether the throttle control inputs in the two remote control modes take into account the current working phase and status to avoid processing errors caused by uncovered scenarios. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for the key remote control actions of the throttle valve, and start the exception handling process when the hardware status has not reached the expected state for a long time. Safety is an important consideration in this process.

requirement: Remote control has the highest control authority and can be switched to remote control mode at any time and in any situation. Safety is ensured under this mode.
safety_requirements: The system should set up a timeout monitoring mechanism for the remote control mode switching operation. If the control right switching is not completed within the preset time, an alarm will be triggered and it will enter Safety mode.

When the system switches to remote control mode, it should check the validity of the current working phase and flight status parameters to ensure that the remote control commands are compatible with the current system state. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system needs to verify the coordination between the timing of remote control mode switching and hardware execution actions, ensuring that the timing logic of control instructions and hardware responses is complete and consistent. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should conduct real-time verification of the control calculation results under remote control mode. When abnormal values, boundary values, or control commands exceeding the safety range are detected, the execution should be immediately terminated and an alarm should be triggered.

After the system restarts due to software power-off, it should check whether the current state of the remote control mode has been fully restored. If there is any state loss or abnormality, it shall prohibit further control until a Safety reset is performed.

requirement: The in-band loop remote control, when the aircraft is in the ground state, the formula for calculating the rudder angle command is: δy = KyY . Y + [Kyg (K . (-yg) + Ky . wy)] + Kywy . wy.
safety_requirements: The system should, according to the current working status and phase, verify whether the calculation process of the rudder angle command conforms to the control logic in the ground state, and ensure that the formula δy = KyY·Y + [Kyg (K·(-yg) + Ky·wy)] + Kywy·wy only takes effect under the ground state, thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should continuously monitor the calculation results of the rudder angle instructions. When abnormal values, boundary values, or extremely large/small values exceeding physical limits are detected, the safety protection mechanism should be triggered immediately.

The system must ensure that the timing of control calculations and hardware execution strictly matches. Control conditions should include complete state identifiers and meet the timing constraint requirements related to the flight phase, thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should perform real-time verification of the data bit accuracy for the input parameters Y, yg, and wy. When the accuracy is higher than required, it should maintain consistency in computational accuracy. When the accuracy is lower than required, it should either execute data compensation or trigger a degradation process. Safety is critical in ensuring these processes are robust and reliable.

Before the system calculates the rudder angle command, it should verify the compatibility of the current operating status attributes of all input parameters with the ground status. Parameters across statuses are prohibited from participating in the calculation.

requirement: Given the linear correspondence relationship between attitude angle and throttle bias δp and remote control operation amount.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the execution sequence, timing, and hardware coordination of the control logic are consistent, the control conditions are complete, and the state before and after maintains consistency. Safety is a priority.

The system should verify the timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combination relationships of the control logic for attitude angles, throttle bias δp, and remote control operation quantities to ensure the correctness of the logic. Safety is also a key factor to be considered in this process.

The system should set a reasonable range (upper and lower limits of the slope) for the parameter change rates of attitude angles, throttle bias δp, and remote control operation quantities, and specify the processing strategy for data exceeding the slope limit.

After the system executes hardware control, it should monitor in real-time whether the hardware status matches the control requirements and make a compliance judgment. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should conduct continuous checks on the working status of different redundancies. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should ensure the correctness of function implementation and take corresponding processing measures. Safety is crucial in this process.

requirement: The system should be able to fly along the prebound route. Safety
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, and that the control conditions are complete and logically consistent. Safety

The system should monitor in real time the consistency between the task execution sequence and the specified sequence. When an abnormal execution sequence is detected, an error handling mechanism should be triggered. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.
All system Safety requirements related to software must be clearly stated and accurately implemented in the software requirements or design documents.

The system should detect operation conflicts of multiple simultaneously executed function points on the same execution agency and take blocking or coordination measures. Safety is crucial in this process.
The system should validate the rationality based on the current equipment status before issuing control instructions or actions that may cause Safety issues.

requirement: The system should control the aircraft to maintain a constant altitude during the final approach phase. When the navigation mode is set to final approach navigation, the flight phase feedback should indicate the final approach phase, and the control method should be the same as that of the constant altitude segment.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the current working phase and navigation mode during the final approach phase to ensure that the control mode is consistent with the altitude-holding phase and meets the requirements of the final approach phase. Safety must be ensured throughout the process.

The system should conduct real-time validation of the control calculation results for the five-sided flight segment, and trigger an exception handling mechanism when abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values appear. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should ensure that the execution sequence and timing of control instructions are coordinated with the hardware system, and the control conditions must be complete and logically consistent. Safety is a priority.

The system should perform priority checking during state transitions to ensure that the correct switching between the five-sided flight segment and altitude hold control mode occurs when a high-priority function switches to a low-priority one or vice versa, thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should continuously monitor the entry conditions of the five-edge flight segment, and automatically perform the corresponding status maintenance or conversion operations when the conditions are not met or met again. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: The FCC collects necessary aircraft motion information, compares it with the required motion to obtain the deviation between the actual aircraft motion and the ideal motion. Then, based on this deviation, it calculates the control law to obtain the control signal, and inputs this control signal into the relevant servomechanism, causing the control surfaces to deflect according to a certain rule, thereby achieving control over the aircraft's attitude and motion with enhanced Safety.
safety_requirements: The FCC should conduct validity checks on the collected aircraft motion information according to the current work phase and status, ensuring that the control calculation process is based on correct input conditions. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The FCC should conduct real-time verification of the control calculation results to ensure that the output control signals meet the safety boundary requirements under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum and minimum values.

The FCC should monitor the execution duration of the control law calculation process to ensure that the computation is completed within the specified time. If it times out, a backup control strategy or alarm mechanism should be triggered. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The control signal output timing of the FCC must strictly match the hardware response characteristics of the servomechanism to ensure that the execution sequence and timing of the control commands meet the system timing Safety requirements.

When the critical control instructions are executed, FCC should set up a hardware status response timeout monitoring mechanism. When it detects that the actuator status has not reached the expected level for a long time, it should automatically activate Safety protection measures

requirement: The system should control the aircraft to descend along the pre-set glide path at the given airspeed from the final approach altitude to the end-of-segment 1 altitude of 100m during segment 1 descent. Longitudinally, the system controls the aircraft to track the glide path height, and laterally eliminates the aircraft's side deviation relative to the airport axis. In case of crosswind, the aircraft should have no sideslip angle. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.
safety_requirements: During the phase when the system is in a slide working stage, it should continuously check whether the functional input parameters meet the requirements of the current working status to ensure that incorrect control calculations are not executed due to unconsidered working stages or statuses. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should verify the results of the 1-segment control calculation to ensure that the rudder deflection angle, airspeed, and altitude tracking commands comply with the flight physical limitations and Safety margins under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, etc.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of the glide slope control command outputs are coordinated with the response capability of the actuation system hardware, preventing control timing conflicts that could cause deviations in the flight path. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

During the 1 segment control process, the system should conduct cross-validation on the data of redundant sensors. When single-redundancy or full-redundancy data fails, the redundant mechanism should be activated or the Safety degradation mode should be triggered.

The system should clearly define the collection range threshold of the descent height sensor. When the height data exceeds the end height of 100 meters ± allowable deviation range, it should immediately report a fault and stop the current descent control. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should continuously monitor the aircraft's sideslip angle under crosswind conditions to ensure that the lateral control calculation can effectively eliminate the side deviation while maintaining a safety state with a sideslip angle of zero degrees.

requirement: The system should control the aircraft to descend from the ending height of 100m of glide segment 1 to the leveling height of 17m in glide segment 2, so that the aircraft can descend in a fixed straight sideslip manner.
safety_requirements: During the 2-stage control process of system descent, it should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, the control conditions are complete and meet the requirements of the current working stage.

The system should conduct real-time checks on the control calculation results of the two segments of the descent, ensuring that the processing logic under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme minimum/maximum values is correct, thus preventing the output of incorrect control commands. Safety must be prioritized throughout this process.

After power failure recovery or runaway reset, the system should automatically detect and restore to the normal control state of segment 2 descent to ensure that the altitude control and sideslip mode conform to the predetermined trajectory, thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should conduct validity checks on input parameters based on the working phase and status of the slide2 segment, and prohibit control calculations when the current phase or status is not identified. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The height data collected by the sensor should be limited to a clear upper and lower limit range. When a value out of range is detected, the sensor fault alarm should be triggered immediately, and the abnormal data should not be used for glide control calculation. Safety is an important consideration in this process.

requirement: The system should flatten the aircraft's trajectory angle during the flattening phase, allowing the aircraft to land with a small descent speed. The lateral control method is the same as that of the post-gliding segment. Safety is critical throughout this process.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware during the flattening phase, and check the completeness and consistency of the control conditions to correctly execute the trajectory inclination flattening and lateral control. Safety is also a critical concern throughout this process.

The system should check during the flattening phase whether the functional inputs take into account the current working stage and status, ensuring that the control calculation process matches the requirements of the flattening phase and lateral control. Safety is a critical factor in this process.

The system should validate the control calculation results during the flare phase to ensure that the processing of calculation results is correct under various conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should check the working status of each redundancy. When two or more redundancies are in different states, it should ensure the correct implementation of the trajectory angle flattening and lateral control functions during the flare phase. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

requirement: The system should meet the conditions for transition to the landing run phase from a height of 1.5m during the roll-to-level phase to the point where the transition conditions are satisfied.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing during the roll-to-level phase are coordinated with the hardware, the control conditions are complete, and there is no conflict in the logic of state transition between the preceding and succeeding states. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should monitor the rate of change of the bank-to-level height parameters to ensure that it is within a reasonable range (upper and lower limits of the slope), and specify the handling strategy for data exceeding the slope limit. Safety is also an important factor to consider in this process.

The system should check the completeness of the status transfer conditions between the roll-to-level phase and the landing run phase, and prevent abnormal status conversion caused by the transfer conditions not being set, always satisfied, or unable to be satisfied. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should check the function of priority difference between the states of the roll-to-level phase and the landing run phase, and ensure that the state and function logic are correct when switching between high and low priorities. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should set a timeout judgment mechanism for the transition process from the roll-to-level phase to the landing rollout phase, to prevent potential safety hazards caused by the hardware status not meeting requirements for a long time.

requirement: During the landing rollout phase, the system should receive a remote control ground contact signal or a full compression signal of the landing gear, or after 75 beats of link abnormality, then enter the landing rollout phase, and use the rudder and brakes to correct the lateral deviation and yaw angle of the aircraft relative to the runway axis. Safety is an important consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: After power failure recovery or runaway reset, the system should return to the normal working condition of the landing rollout phase, and continue to correct the lateral deviation and yaw angle of the aircraft relative to the runway centerline through the rudder and brakes. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should conduct real-time checks on the control calculation results of the rudder and brakes to ensure that under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values, the output of corrective actions conforms to the expected logic and safety constraints.

When the system enters the landing run phase, it should verify the legality of the current working phase and status inputs to ensure that the control calculations for the rudder and brakes only take effect under conditions that satisfy the ground contact signal, landing gear compression signal, or a 75-beat trigger due to link anomalies. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

After the system restarts due to a software power loss, it should check and restore to the current state of the landing rollout phase, ensuring that the control commands for the rudder and brakes are consistent with the state before the restart and have no error accumulation, thereby guaranteeing Safety.

The system should ensure that the control timing of the rudder and brakes is coordinated with the response capability of the hardware actuators. The triggering sequence of the control conditions needs to maintain completeness and temporal consistency with the physical constraints during the landing rollout phase, thereby guaranteeing Safety.

requirement: The system should control the aircraft to enter the gliding phase after air停车 during the gliding phase.
safety_requirements: During the phase when the system controls the aircraft entering the gliding segment, it should ensure that the sequence and timing of control commands are coordinated with the relevant hardware equipment, and maintain the completeness and consistency of control conditions. Safety is critical in this process.

After power failure recovery or runaway reset, the system should automatically restore to the normal control state of the drop segment, ensuring the aircraft safely enters the drop phase. Safety must be guaranteed during this process.

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for the key control steps of the falling section. If the hardware status does not meet the requirements within the specified time, the exception handling process will be triggered.

During the control process of the drifting phase, the system should conduct validity checks on input parameters to ensure they meet the constraint conditions of the current working phase and status. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should conduct real-time verification of the control calculation results for the falling section, including the processing of normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme values, etc., to ensure the Safety and rationality of the output control instructions.

requirement: The remote control operation corresponds to the deflection angle command of the control surface and the throttle bias command. The linear correspondence between the rudder angle, throttle commands and the remote control operation is: δz (-28°~+28°), δx (-20°~+20°), δy (-25°~+25°), δp (0~115%). The amplitude limit is [-30°,+20°].
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time checks on the rudder deflection angles δz, δx, δy, and throttle δp calculated from remote control operations to ensure that their values are correct under normal, boundary, extreme maximum, and minimum conditions, and trigger processing mechanisms for abnormal values. These checks are essential to guarantee Safety.

The system should verify that the control sequence and timing of the rudder surface deflection commands and throttle commands are coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions should be complete and maintain consistent states before and after. Safety is critical in this process.

The system must clearly define the sensor collection range (upper and lower limits). When the sensor input exceeds the specified range, it should immediately flag a sensor fault and stop related control outputs.

The system should monitor the change rate of the rudder angle and throttle commands. When detecting that it exceeds the upper/lower limit of the slope, the preset over-slope processing strategy should be executed. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should verify the validity of the remote control input at different working stages and flight conditions to ensure that the control calculation process fully matches the current working status and stage, thereby ensuring Safety.

requirement: Elevator control amount (0～255), aileron control amount (0～255), rudder control amount (0～255), throttle control amount (0～255).
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time monitoring on the rate of change of the control quantities of elevators, ailerons, rudders, and throttle valves, ensuring they are within the predefined upper and lower limits of the slope range, and implement predefined processing strategies for data exceeding the slope limits to guarantee Safety.

The system should perform integrity verification on the control calculation results to ensure that the functional processing results of the elevators, ailerons, rudders, and throttle manipulations are as expected under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should conduct synchronous checks on the working states of different redundancies. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should implement a redundant state coordination mechanism to ensure the correctness of functional processing. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should conduct status and working phase relevance verification on the functional input parameters to ensure that the control calculation process strictly matches the current working status and phase requirements, avoiding calculation errors caused by failure to consider the status or phase. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: By using the remote control switch command, the deflection of the ailerons and elevators is attenuated to 2/3 of the above values, so that the corresponding relationship becomes: δz (-20º~+20º), δx (-13º~+13º), δy (-25º~+25º), δp (0~115%).
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the rate of change of the rudder angles δz, δx, δy, and δp to ensure they remain within the preset upper and lower slope limits, and execute predefined processing strategies, such as restriction or alarms, when exceeded. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should validate the control calculation results to ensure that the outputs of δz (－20º~+20º), δx (－13º~+13º), δy (－25º~+25º), δp (0～115％) are all in line with the expected logic under normal, abnormal, boundary, and extreme value conditions. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should clearly define the range of sensor data collection and trigger a sensor failure alarm when detecting parameters δz, δx, δy, δp exceeding the upper or lower limits. The Safety of the system operation must be ensured under all circumstances.

The system should perform a status validity check on the input remote control switch command based on the current working status and phase, ensuring that the control calculation process matches the current status. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should conduct real-time comparison of continuous output data with different redundancies. When the redundancy output difference of rudder deflection angles δz, δx, δy, or δp exceeds the threshold, the redundant processing mechanism should be initiated or a fault alarm triggered to ensure Safety.

requirement: The control range and precision requirements for elevator control (0~255), aileron control (0~255), rudder control (0~255), and throttle control (0~255).
safety_requirements: The system should check the control calculation results of elevators, ailerons, rudders, and throttle valves to ensure that the output meets the control range requirement of 0～255 in cases of normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, etc.

The system should check the precision of the interface data bits to ensure that the output result meets the functional processing specification when the precision of the data bit values exceeds the requirement. Safety is also an important factor to consider in this process.
