The system should check the precision of the interface data bits to ensure that the output result meets the functional processing specifications when the precision of the data bits is lower than required Safety.

The system should check the input of the four control quantities according to the current working phase and flight status, ensuring that the control calculation process correctly matches the processing logic of different working phases and states. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should ensure that the order and timing of control calculations are coordinated with the hardware devices, and verify the completeness and logical consistency of the control conditions. Safety is also a key consideration in this process.

requirement: During the ground waiting phase of the aircraft, the elevator angle command, aileron angle command, and rudder angle command are all set to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system should determine whether the elevator angle command, aileron angle command, and rudder angle command comply with the ground waiting phase scenario. Commands that do not comply should be rejected.

During the ground waiting phase when the system issues control instructions, it should judge the Safety of the instructions based on the actual status of the aircraft equipment, and block non-zero-degree instructions that may cause danger.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the working status with different control redundancy. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in an inconsistent state, it should prohibit the execution of non-zero degree deflection angle commands until the states are synchronized. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

When the system detects that two or more redundancies are in an abnormal working state, it should automatically switch to redundant redundancy or Safety mode, and keep the deflection angle command at 0°.

The system should check the legality of state transitions. When an illegal transition between the ground waiting phase and other states is detected, the current bias angle command should be maintained at 0° and state changes should be prohibited to ensure Safety.

The system should continuously verify the entry conditions for the ground waiting phase. When the entry conditions fail, the bias angle command should be maintained at 0° and a status abnormality alarm should be triggered. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The implementation of five flight control modes: autonomous control, manual correction control, command control, attitude remote control, and surface remote control, ensures Safety.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control logic, timing relationships, constraint relationships, concurrent relationships, and combination relationships among the five flight control modes - autonomous control, manual correction control, command control, attitude remote control, and control surface remote control - are all correct without error.

When the system switches between different working states and phases, it should check the integrity and validity of the functional input parameters to ensure that unconsidered working phases or states will not cause abnormal control modes. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring on the calculation results of the five flight control modes, verify whether the control calculation values are within the normal range, and trigger corresponding Safety handling mechanisms for abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, etc.

The system should ensure that the timing of control mode switching is strictly synchronized with the hardware execution timing. The control conditions must meet the hardware interface constraints and the logic before and after should remain consistent. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system needs to set up a timeout detection mechanism for the control mode calculation process. When the result is not returned within the specified time, it should automatically switch to Safety mode and generate an alarm signal.

requirement: Special handling during control mode switching
safety_requirements: The system should validate the control calculation results when switching control modes to ensure that the handling of different situations such as 'normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values' meets expectations. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
During the switching process of operational scenarios, the system should analyze and eliminate potential hazardous states that may be caused by control functions to ensure Safety.

The system should conduct validity checks on functional inputs under different operating conditions and phases to ensure that the control calculation process matches the current operating status and phase, thereby ensuring Safety.

requirement: When switching to a control law with an integrator, in order to ensure a smooth transition of the corresponding given attitude angle Jg, Yg, or yg, the initial value of the integrator for the next stage of the control law is not simply set to zero. requirement: When switching from the take-off departure phase to the climb phase 1, set the given pitch angle calculated at the moment before the take-off departure phase transfers to the climb phase 1 as Jg, and the initial value of the airspeed integrator as x, then x is calculated as: x = Jg - Kv [nk (k) - ng (k)] / K vI.

safety_requirements: The system should validate the input parameters of the given attitude angle, control surface command, or throttle during the phase conversion of flight or switching of control modes, to ensure the correctness of the processing procedure based on the current working phase and status, for Safety.

The system should ensure that the execution sequence, timing, and hardware operations of control instructions are coordinated, and that control conditions maintain completeness and logical consistency between different states. Safety must also be considered in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the control calculation results. When abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values are detected, a safety amplitude limit or abnormality handling mechanism should be triggered.

After the system restarts due to a software power loss, it should automatically recover to a Safety state and verify the current status of the flight phase/control mode to ensure the continuity and correctness of the softening treatment logic.

The system should clearly set all state transition conditions to prevent state transition failure or abnormal looping caused by missing conditions, conditions that are always met, or conditions that cannot be met. Safety is a critical factor in this process.

requirement: Two softening methods are selected: one for softening during switching between control modes with inner loops or during flight phase transitions, and the other for softening when switching to remote control modes without inner loops. Safety is a crucial consideration in both methods.
safety_requirements: The system should check the current working stage and status information when switching control modes or flight phases to ensure the correct selection of the corresponding softening method, thereby enhancing Safety.

The system should conduct real-time verification of the transfer conditions between each pair of states to prevent errors in the selection of softening methods caused by unset, always satisfied, or unsatisfiable transfer conditions thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should be equipped with a state transfer priority management mechanism to ensure the correctness of softening method selection when switching between high-priority and low-priority functions.

The system should conduct synchronous monitoring on the working status of different redundancies to prevent abnormal selection of softening methods caused by status differences between redundancies. Safety is crucial in this process.
The system should continuously monitor the matching of the softening method and the control mode/remote control mode, and trigger a safety warning when an inconsistent status is detected.

requirement: The flight control system must have a notch filter function to attenuate the structural vibration mode signals of the aircraft, ensuring Safety and stability of the system.
safety_requirements: The flight control system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of the notch filter function are consistent with the hardware, and the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety is critical in this process.

The flight control system should perform filtering and anti-shaking processing during the signal acquisition phase, effectively shielding interference data to ensure the Safety of the input signal for the notch filter function.

The flight control system should check the results of the control calculation after notch filtering to ensure that the processing is correct under various conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values. Safety is crucial in this process.

The flight control system should set a timeout judgment mechanism for critical control or actions to prevent the system from becoming unstable due to the hardware status not meeting the control requirements for a long time. This mechanism is crucial for Safety.

requirement: The elevator channel in the flight control system should include two notch filters, one located between the control law output and the servo loop, and the other after the pitch acceleration pre-filter.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the coordination of the control timing of two notch filters in the elevator channel with the hardware, and verify the completeness and consistency of the control conditions. Safety is also a key factor to consider in this process.

The circuit of the two notch filters in the elevator channel should have a real-time status detection mechanism to ensure that the circuit status can be detected without affecting the normal output. Safety is an important consideration in this design.

Under different working conditions or phases, the system should conduct validity checks on the input data of the two notch filters in the elevator channel to prevent calculation errors caused by not considering the working conditions or phases. Safety is a priority in all operations.

The timing of the control state switching for the two notch filters in the elevator channel should strictly comply with the requirements of the current flight scenario and working conditions. Safety is critical in this process.

requirement: The parameters of the notch filter between the control law output and the rudder loop should be set as x1z = 0.1, x2z = 0.6, wn1z = 24.3, wn2z = 24.3.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the settings of the notch filter parameters (x1z, x2z, wn1z, wn2z) between the control law output and the servo loop are coordinated with the hardware control timing and sequence, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent. The system should check the setting values of the notch filter parameters (x1z, x2z, wn1z, wn2z) between the control law output and the servo loop. The system should conduct an input check on the settings of the notch filter parameters (x1z, x2z, wn1z, wn2z) between the control law output and the servo loop according to the current working status and phase, ensuring that the parameter settings meet the requirements of the current working status and phase. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

Safety must also be considered in this process.

The system should set a timeout judgment for the configuration of notch filter parameters or critical adjustment operations, and deal with the situation where the hardware status does not meet the requirements for a long time.

requirement: The pitch acceleration in the longitudinal control law during the flare phase needs to be processed by the pitch acceleration notch filter 2.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the timing of the longitudinal control law processing elevator acceleration during the flare phase is strictly synchronized with hardware operations, and verify the completeness and consistency of control conditions under different operating states. The system should conduct real-time verification on the output result of acceleration notch filter 2 to ensure that it meets the safety tolerance requirements of the control law under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme values.

The system should define a reasonable range for the rate of change of lift acceleration parameters and immediately activate preset processing strategies (such as data limiting or control law switching) when detecting over-slope data. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: The notch filter parameters for the aileron channel are x1x = 0.1, x2x = 0.6, wn1x = 24.3, wn2x = 24.3.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the rate of change of the aileron channel notch filter parameters (x1x, x2x, wn1x, wn2x) to ensure they remain within a predefined reasonable range, and implement clear processing strategies for parameter values that exceed the upper or lower slope limits. The system should check the length of the aileron channel interface data frame to ensure that it meets the specified length requirements; when the data length is greater than or less than the specified value, appropriate processing measures should be taken. Safety is crucial in this process.

The upper and lower limits of the sensor's acquisition range should be clearly defined, and a sensor failure alarm should be triggered when a signal outside the acquisition range is detected. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should monitor the communication status of the aileron channel interface data frame, detect the data frame drop situation, and execute the corresponding data recovery or compensation mechanism when a frame drop occurs to ensure Safety.

The system should check the capacity of the data reception buffer for the aileron channel interface to ensure that it is no less than the data volume. When the capacity is insufficient, effective overflow processing measures should be taken to ensure data integrity and Safety.

requirement: The notch filter parameters for the rudder channel are x1y = 0.1, x2y = 0.5999922, wn1y = 40.81997, wn2y = 25.11991.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the rate of change of the parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y of the rudder channel notch filter, ensure that they are within a reasonable range (upper and lower limits of the slope), and adopt a clear processing strategy for data exceeding the threshold. Safety is also a consideration in this process.

The system should conduct real-time checks on the continuous value domain of the rudder channel interface data. If the difference between multiple cycles of data exceeds the specified threshold (slope fault), an abnormality handling mechanism should be triggered to ensure the correctness of the output results and Safety.

The system should define the range (upper and lower limits) for the rudder channel sensor data acquisition. When it detects that the sensor input value exceeds this range, it should immediately report a sensor failure and stop the relevant control output. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should validate the input parameters of the rudder channel according to the current working status and phase, ensuring that the control calculation process meets the requirements of the working status and phase, avoiding calculation errors caused by 'unconsidered states'. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should continuously monitor the real-time performance of the notch filter processing to ensure that the filter delay time is within an acceptable range. When the real-time performance index exceeds the limit, an alarm should be triggered and the system should enter a degraded processing mode.

requirement: After adopting the Tustin bilinear transformation, the formula for the discretized notch filter is δd(k) = [- Kd12δd(k-1) - Kd22δd(k-2) + Kd01δ(k) + Kd11δ(k-1) + Kd].
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the discrete value domain data bits in the interface data. When there is a jump change in the data of adjacent cycles, it should ensure that the δd(k) output result calculated by the discretized notch filter is accurate and conforms to the expected logic. Safety must be considered during this process.
The system should verify the impact of the delay introduced by filtering processing on real-time performance and ensure that this impact is within a pre-defined acceptable range Safety.

The system should continuously verify the control calculation result δd(k). When abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values are detected, the safety handling mechanism should be immediately activated and the abnormal event should be recorded.

The system needs to perform validity checks on the filter input parameters based on the current working phase and flight status, ensuring that the correct calculation logic is used under different working conditions. Safety is a priority in this process.

requirement: The system should be able to calculate the rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy based on the current flight status and target status.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control sequence and timing are coordinated with the hardware, verify the completeness and consistency of the control conditions, to ensure the correctness of the rudder deflection angle δz, δx, and δy calculations. Safety is also ensured through this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the working status of different redundancies. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should ensure the correct calculation results of rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy, and trigger the status synchronization or alarm mechanism. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should validate the functional inputs to ensure that the current working status and phase are considered at different working stages and states, preventing calculation errors of rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy caused by neglect.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the control calculation results. When abnormal values, boundary values, maximum values, or minimum values are detected in the calculation results, the output should be limited or an alarm should be triggered, and it must be ensured that the calculation results of rudder deflection angles δz, δx, and δy are within a safe range. Safety must be guaranteed.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the functions of acceleration notch filter 2, including parameter settings and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the sequence and timing of the control flow for the acceleration notch filter 2 with the hardware coordination, ensuring that the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety must be considered throughout this process.

The system should conduct real-time checks on the control calculation results of the acceleration notch filter 2 (normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values) and ensure the correctness of the processing logic. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should implement a timeout judgment mechanism for the critical control settings of acceleration notch filter 2, which triggers exception handling when the hardware status remains unmet for an extended period. Safety is ensured through this mechanism.

The system should validate the input parameters of the acceleration notch filter 2 according to the current working phase and status, to prevent incorrect calculations that do not consider the operating conditions.

The system should continuously monitor the execution conditions of the acceleration notch filter 2. Take corresponding control measures and record the status changes when the conditions are not met or restored. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function of the aileron channel, including parameter settings and filtering processing. Safety is an important consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The software system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of the aileron channel notch filter are consistent with the hardware, and the control conditions are complete and the front and rear states are consistent. Safety is critical in this process.

The software system should detect abnormal external conditions such as high sea state and adverse weather, and trigger the corresponding processing mechanism of the aileron channel notch filter. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The software system should verify the control calculation results of the aileron channel notch filter to ensure that the processing results under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme minimum and maximum values meet the Safety requirements.

The software system should real-time monitor the execution condition status of the aileron channel notch filter, and execute the correct functional response or recovery operation when the conditions are not met or met again. Safety is crucial in this process.

The software system should implement a timeout judgment mechanism for the critical control or action of the aileron channel notch filter to prevent safety risks caused by the hardware status not meeting requirements for an extended period.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function of the rudder channel, including parameter settings and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: The software system should ensure that the control sequence and timing of the rudder channel notch filter are consistent with the hardware, and the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety is also a key concern in this process.

The software system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for the critical control operations of the rudder channel notch filter. When the hardware status has not met the control requirements for a long time, it triggers exception handling to ensure Safety.

The software system should verify the control calculation results of the rudder channel notch filter to ensure that the function processing is correct under various conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum/minimum values. Safety must always be a priority in this process.

The software system should monitor the execution conditions of the rudder channel notch filter function and ensure that the function processing meets expectations when the execution conditions are not met or are met again. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The software system should conduct status and operational phase suitability checks on the inputs to the rudder channel notch filter function, ensuring that the calculation process matches the current operational status and phase. Safety is a priority in this process.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the Tustin bilinear transformation discretization processing to generate the discrete formula of the notch filter.
safety_requirements: The system should perform real-time monitoring on data bits with discrete value ranges in the interface data to ensure that when the data values of two adjacent cycles change abruptly, the output result of the formula for the notch filter after discretization processing is correct and effective. Safety must also be considered during this process.

The system should monitor the rate of change of discretization processing parameters to ensure that it remains within a predefined reasonable range (upper and lower limits of slope). When the range is exceeded, a predefined superslope processing strategy should be executed. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should perform an integrity check on the transfer conditions between each pair of states in the software state space, ensuring that the transfer conditions are reasonably set and can still correctly execute state transitions even in boundary cases such as "not set, always satisfied, unable to be satisfied".

The system should perform effective value domain verification on the data bits with discrete value ranges in the interface data. For abnormal inputs such as "undefined abnormal values outside the valid value domain", the system should implement data filtering or alarm mechanisms. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure that the execution order and timing of the Tustin bilinear transformation discretization process are strictly synchronized with the hardware system, and the control conditions need to remain consistent before and after and cover all possible operating scenarios. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

requirement: The flaps have three deflection angle positions: 0°, 15°, and 40°, which are adjusted according to the needs of different stages of the flight process or the requirements of remote control.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the working status of each redundancy. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should suspend the flap control action, enter Safety mode, and trigger the status synchronization mechanism.

The system should verify the flap control commands to ensure that they match the current flight phase and operating status, and prohibit operations from being executed without considering the operating phase or status. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should compare the flap control input data received from each redundancy. If it finds inconsistency in the same input data among different redundancies, it should prohibit the execution of the command and initiate the data verification process to ensure Safety.

The system needs to continuously monitor the output data of each redundancy. If it detects abnormalities or failures in one or more redundant outputs, it should automatically switch to the redundant margin and trigger a fault alarm. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should verify the matching of the actual flap angle position (0°, 15°, 40°) with the control command and the current flight phase. If there is any inconsistency, an alarm will be triggered and the flap movement will be stopped. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

requirement: The system should be able to automatically adjust the flap deflection position based on the information provided by the identification module for the flight phase. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the coordination of the sequence and timing of flap angle adjustment control with the hardware execution to ensure that the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should have a timeout judgment mechanism for adjusting the flap angle. When the hardware status does not meet the control requirements for a long time, it triggers a warning or switches to redundancy.

The system should check the calculation results of flap angle control to ensure that the processing logic is correct under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, and execute a Safety response in case of abnormalities.

The system should verify the integrity of the working phase and status parameters in the flap deflection adjustment input based on the information provided by the flight phase identification module, to prevent control errors caused by failure to consider the status. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the working status of flaps with different redundancies. When two or more redundancies are detected to be in an inconsistent state, it should ensure that the deflection angle adjustment function can still be correctly executed and trigger the status synchronization or redundancy switching mechanism. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: The system should support remote control for manually adjusting the deflection angle position of the flaps.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the control process sequence, timing, and hardware actions are strictly coordinated when remotely manually adjusting the flap deflection angle, and verify the completeness and consistency of the control conditions. Safety must also be considered in this process.

The system should set up a timeout monitoring mechanism for manual flap adjustment operations. When the hardware status does not reach the control target within the specified time, the operation should be automatically terminated and an exception alarm should be triggered. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

After the system sends the control command of the flap position, it should continuously monitor the actual hardware status and compare it with the control requirements. When inconsistency is found, it should immediately stop the adjustment and record the abnormality.

The system should ensure that the timing of flap control state output complies with the safety requirements of the current flight scenario, avoiding unintended triggering or delayed response during critical flight phases.

The system should validate the calculation results of the flap angle control, including the verification of processing logic under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum/minimum value scenarios, to ensure automatic switching to Safety mode in abnormal situations.

requirement: The system should be able to receive and process the data provided by the flight phase identification module to determine the current flight phase. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should check the matching of the transmission and reception cycle of the flight phase identification module data to ensure the correctness of data processing. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should ensure the correct execution of functional processing logic when it receives input data again during task execution, avoiding duplicate or conflicting operations. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure the correctness of the output results and trigger the communication abnormality alarm mechanism when it continuously fails to receive new data from the flight phase identification module. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should verify the identification information of the data frame in the flight phase recognition module to ensure the compliance of the communication protocol and the validity of the data. Safety is also a key concern in this process.

The system should ensure the correctness of the output results and execute data recovery or exception handling mechanisms when detecting frame loss of the flight phase identification module data frame. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The system should be able to select the appropriate flap angle position according to the current flight phase. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should verify that the sequence and timing of controlling the flap deflection position is coordinated with the hardware, and ensure that the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety is also ensured in this process.
The system should ensure that the output timing of the flap angle position meets the requirements of the current flight phase scenario. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should monitor the rate of change of the flap angle parameters, ensure that it is within a reasonable range, and implement a clear processing strategy for data with excessive slope. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should conduct real-time checks on the working status of different redundancies. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should ensure the correctness of function implementation and take corresponding processing measures. Safety is crucial in this process.

requirement: The system should be able to record and display the current deflection angle position of the flaps.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the operation of recording and displaying the current deflection angle position of the flaps is coordinated with the hardware control timing, and verify the completeness and consistency of the control conditions. Safety must also be considered in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the working status of different redundancies. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should ensure that the recorded and displayed flap deflection angle position data is accurate and trigger an alarm for inconsistent status. Safety must be prioritized throughout this process.

After the system is recovered, it should verify the real-time nature of the recording and display functions for the current deflection angle position of the flaps to ensure that the key status data meets the real-time requirements. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should compare the output data of different redundancies. When a single or multiple redundancy failures are detected, the system should continue to record and display the flap angle position using the valid redundancy data, and record the fault event. Safety is the priority in this process.

requirement: The system needs to discretize according to the given pitch angle Jg and roll angle Yg as well as the rudder control amount yg, using the bilinear transformation method to calculate the values of δz (k), δx (k), and δy (k).
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time the rate of change of pitch angle Jg, roll angle Yg, and rudder control amount yg, ensuring they remain within the set slope range, and implement predefined processing strategies for out-of-limit values. Safety is a priority during this process.

The system should ensure that the sequence and timing of control calculations are coordinated with hardware operations, all control conditions are complete and logically consistent, and avoid abnormal calculation results caused by timing errors. Safety is also a key concern in this process.

The system should validate the calculated δz(k), δx(k), and δy(k) for validity, addressing normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, and execute corresponding processing procedures to ensure the correctness of the calculation results. Safety is ensured through this process.

The system should perform periodic jump change detection on the discrete data bits of the input pitch angle Jg, roll angle Yg, and rudder control amount yg, to ensure that the data changes between adjacent periods meet expectations, and handle abnormal jump change values. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should conduct validity checks on the input pitch angle Jg, roll angle Yg, and rudder control amount yg based on the current working status and phase, to ensure that the control calculation process is consistent with the current status and phase, and to avoid calculation errors caused by failure to consider the status or phase. This ensures Safety.

requirement: During the ground waiting phase, the flaps are set to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system should check the data processing during the flap control process to ensure that there is no division by zero operation, preventing calculation abnormalities from causing incorrect flap angle settings. Safety considerations are paramount in this process.

The system should evaluate the rationality of the flap operation instructions issued by the personnel, and not respond to non-0° flap instructions during the ground waiting phase. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

When the conditions for switching the flap control redundancy are met but the switch fails, the system should execute a preset error handling procedure to ensure that the flaps remain at 0° or trigger a backup control mechanism. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should verify the values of flap control interface data when transferring working states. If it is currently in the ground waiting phase and the data has not changed, it should ensure that the flap angle remains at 0° and outputs the correct command. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should validate the effectiveness of flap-related parameters set by personnel, and prompt or reject responses for parameters that do not meet the requirements of the ground waiting phase (such as non-0° settings). Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

requirement: When the aircraft performs take-off, from the ground running phase, the flaps are deflected to 15°.
safety_requirements: After power failure recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should ensure that the flaps return to the 15° deflection state during ground running, and verify the consistency between control commands and flight phases. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should limit the rate of change of the flap deflection angle within a preset safety range (such as ±X°/s), and when detecting overslope data, it should pause the action and trigger an alarm.

The system should perform integrity checks on communication data frames. When data frame loss occurs, the flap control should maintain the current 15° deflection state until communication is restored, and abnormal events should be recorded. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure that the sending timing of flap control commands is strictly synchronized with hardware responses, and prioritize executing the 15° flap deflection action at the start of the ground run. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should conduct real-time comparison of multiple redundancy working states. When inconsistency in redundancy status is detected, it should automatically switch to the main redundancy and execute a 15° flap deflection control while recording the state differences. Safety is ensured throughout this process.

requirement: Timing starts when flying to the climb phase 1. If the landing gear is retracted within 1 minute, the flaps will be retracted to 0° after a 5-second delay from the moment of retraction.
safety_requirements: The system should check if the landing gear retraction time is within 1 minute. If not, it should prohibit the execution of the flaps retraction to 0° and trigger an abnormal alarm. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should perform precise timing for the 5-second delay after the landing gear is retracted to ensure that the delay time error does not exceed the allowable range, thereby guaranteeing Safety.
The system should verify that the flaps retraction action is only triggered after the landing gear is fully retracted. Reverse sequence operations are prohibited to ensure Safety.

The system should validate the validity of the timing start condition (entering the climb phase 1) to prevent functional abnormalities caused by premature or delayed triggering of the timing. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.
The system should monitor the timing validity of the status input signals for the landing gear and mark the status signals that are input too early or too late, then take Safety handling measures.

requirement: If the landing gear is still not retracted after 1 minute, then directly retract the flaps to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the duration of the landing gear retraction task and ensure that if it is not completed within 1 minute, the operation of setting the flaps to 0° is correctly executed, and handle the task timeout exception. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should detect the redundancy switching time, and if the switching time exceeds the specified limit, it should ensure that the flaps can still be correctly retracted to 0° without retracting the landing gear. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should handle the situation of margin switching failure, ensuring that the flaps can be set to 0° command even when the landing gear is not retracted. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism. When the landing gear is not retracted for more than 1 minute, the flaps should be forcibly retracted to 0°, and the abnormal status should be recorded. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should monitor the data communication of the landing gear status interface. If no new data is continuously received, a backup strategy should be initiated to ensure the correctness of the flap retraction action. Safety is crucial in this process.

requirement: When the aircraft flies to the fourth side of the five-edge route, if the distance to the point is less than 1500m, then set flaps to 15°.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the working status of each redundancy. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should suspend the flap control function and trigger a fault alarm to ensure Safety.

The acquisition range of the distance sensor must specify the upper and lower limits. When the detected distance data is beyond the valid range, the system should determine that the sensor has failed and prohibit the execution of the command to lower the flaps for Safety reasons.

The system should continuously compare the output data of each redundant degree. When a single degree or multiple degrees of abnormal output are detected, it should implement the redundant voting mechanism and trigger fault indication to ensure Safety.

The slope upper and lower limits of the flap angle change rate must be clearly defined. When the system detects that the safe change rate is exceeded, it should immediately stop the current flap adjustment action and activate the Safety protection mechanism

requirement: When flying to the fifth side, lower the flaps 40° when the distance to the predetermined landing point is less than Hw / tgλ + 1020 m and greater than Hw / tgλ + 20 m.
safety_requirements: The system should verify whether the distance to the predetermined landing point is within the range of Hw/tgλ + 20m to Hw/tgλ + 1020m when flying to the final approach. The operation of extending flaps to 40° is only allowed when the condition is met, and the control command shall not be triggered when the condition is not satisfied. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should set clear upper and lower limit thresholds for the distance sensor acquisition values. When it detects that the sensor data exceeds the valid measurement range, it should immediately report a sensor failure and stop the flap control output. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should monitor the duration of the 40° flap control state to ensure it meets the predefined time constraint requirements, and trigger an exception handling mechanism when the allowable duration is exceeded. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should conduct real-time comparisons of the working states of different redundancies. When it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should suspend the flap control output and enter a Safety state while recording the state discrepancy event.

requirement: If the aircraft does not enter the glide window, then after the aircraft regains its altitude, the flaps are retracted to 15° (Vg changes accordingly).
safety_requirements: The system should pause the operation of retracting the flaps to 15° and prohibit the corresponding changes in Vg when it continuously fails to receive new data from the interface data frame, until the data is restored or switches to a backup data source. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

When the redundancy switching condition is met but the switch fails, the system should prohibit the operation of retracting the flaps to 15°, trigger a redundancy fault alarm, and enter the Safety hold mode.

The system should abort the current command to maintain altitude and retract the flaps to 15° and initiate the data integrity verification mechanism when it detects frame loss in the data packet. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should prohibit the retraction of flaps to 15° during communication interruptions, maintaining the current flap status until communication is restored and redundancy verification is passed. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should establish a communication failure recovery mechanism. After recovery, it is necessary to re-validate whether the condition of not entering the glide window is satisfied. After confirmation, the operation of retracting the flaps to 15° can be continued. Safety must always be prioritized during these operations and verifications.

requirement: If the aircraft enters the glide window, the flaps will remain at 40° until full landing.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to power loss, it should check if the flaps have returned to 40°. If the status has not been restored or is abnormal, an alarm should be triggered, and the current flap position should be maintained until complete landing. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should ensure that the flaps remain at 40° until communication is restored or landing is completed, in case of interface data communication interruption, reconnection, or inability to recover due to power failure and reboot. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should check the current working stage and status during the control calculation process, and only execute the control logic of maintaining the flaps at 40° in the glide window phase. Inputs unrelated to this function in other phases should be prohibited from interfering with this function. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should continuously monitor the conditions for entering the glide slope window status. When the conditions are not met or met again, the flaps should still be kept at 40° until complete landing, and record the abnormal status events. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should suspend the flap control action and maintain the current 40° position when the redundancy switching time exceeds the threshold, triggering the redundant system takeover or Safety degradation mechanism.

requirement: During normal landing, the system starts to deploy flaps to 15° at point A and to 40° at point B; during reverse landing, the system starts to deploy flaps to 15° at point C and to 40° at point D.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the timing, constraints, concurrency, and combinational relationships of the control logic between point A and point B during normal landing, and between point C and point D during reverse landing, to ensure the correct and conflict-free sequence and conditions of the flap angle changes. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should conduct real-time detection of the working phase and flight status for forward/reverse landing, ensure that the trigger points (A/B or C/D points) for the flaps being lowered strictly match the current working phase and status, and avoid control errors caused by not considering the phase. The system should ensure that the timing of flap control is coordinated with hardware actions, all control conditions are complete, and the logic is consistent before and after, to prevent abnormal flap movements caused by timing misalignment or missing conditions. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: In the remote control mode, when the system receives a control command of "flap position 0" from the remote control, it sends out a 0° flap control signal; when it receives a "flap position 1" control command, it sends out a 15° flap control signal; and when it receives a "flap position 2" control command, it sends out a 40° flap control signal.
safety_requirements: When the system receives a flap position control command in the remote control mode, it should check the current working phase and status to ensure that the command processing meets the requirements of the corresponding phase and status, preventing errors caused by failure to consider the working phase or status. The system should verify the results of the flap control calculations to ensure that the calculated flap angle values are within the normal range, and trigger the Safety handling mechanism in cases of abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, etc.

The system should ensure that the sending sequence and timing of the flap control signals are coordinated with the hardware system, the control conditions are complete and the logic is consistent before and after, and avoid the control failure caused by timing conflicts or missing conditions. After the system restarts due to power loss, it should check the recovery status of the flap control to ensure that the flap position status is correctly restored or enters a Safety state after rebooting, preventing abnormalities caused by failure to recover or incorrect recovery.

requirement: The system needs to set different given attitude angles according to different flight phases during the take-off departure segment. Specifically: longitudinal Jg = 4.5°, lateral yg = 0°.
safety_requirements: When the system outputs the control status during the take-off departure phase, it should ensure that the timing strictly conforms to the requirements of the current flight phase. The longitudinal Jg angle is set to 4.5°, the lateral yg angle is set to 0°, and it should be coordinated with the hardware control sequence.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the working status of different redundancies. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should verify the functional input data by explicitly taking into account the current working phase and flight status to ensure that the control calculation process correctly applies the given attitude angle settings of 4.5° longitudinally and 0° laterally for the take-off segment. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system needs to check the execution order and timing of control instructions for compatibility with the hardware system, ensuring that control conditions are complete and consistent before and after, avoiding abnormal attitude angle settings caused by timing conflicts. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: The retraction control of the landing gear is achieved by sending a retract signal and checking if it has been retracted via a lock-up signal. The deployment control of the landing gear is achieved by sending a deploy signal and checking if it has been deployed via a lock-down signal. If the deployment fails, an emergency deployment signal can be sent to activate the emergency pump.
safety_requirements: Under different working conditions and phases, the system should check whether the landing gear control input signals (retracting signal and deploying signal) meet the requirements of the current working phase and status, and prevent control errors caused by failure to consider the status. Safety is a priority in all phases.

The system should verify the control calculation results of the retraction lock signal and the deployment lock signal, ensuring that they can be correctly handled when they are normal values, boundary values, or abnormal values. In abnormal situations, trigger an alarm or emergency mechanism. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

After the system restarts due to power loss, it should check whether the current status of the landing gear is consistent with the actual status and ensure that the status is correctly restored after the restart, avoiding control failure caused by incorrect recovery. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should ensure that the retraction/deployment control signals of the landing gear are fully coordinated in timing and sequence with hardware devices such as hydraulic actuators and emergency pumps, and the control conditions need to be consistent and complete before and after. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should set up a timeout monitoring mechanism for the landing gear control calculation process. If the result is not returned within the specified time (such as confirmation of retraction/drop status), it should automatically trigger an emergency drop signal or Safety protection measures.

requirement: The landing gear can be controlled for retraction and deployment in autonomous control, manual correction, and remote control modes. During autonomous control or manual correction, the flight control system automatically retracts and deploys the landing gear based on the aircraft's position, motion, and other information. In remote control mode, the ground control station can issue commands at any time to retract and deploy the landing gear. Safety is a crucial factor in all these operations.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the functional inputs meet the requirements of the current working phase and status when switching between different control modes (autonomous control, manual correction, remote control mode), ensuring that the landing gear retraction and extension control logic matches the mode. After power failure recovery or runaway reset, the system should automatically detect the current status of the landing gear and return to a safe working mode to prevent unexpected retraction and extension operations of the landing gear. Safety is the priority in this process.

The system should ensure that the sending sequence and timing of landing gear control commands are strictly synchronized with the hardware actuators. The control conditions need to cover all possible combinations of operating states and maintain logical consistency. Safety is a priority.

The system should set up a timeout detection mechanism for controlling the solving process. If the landing gear control calculation is not completed within the specified time, the current operation should be terminated immediately and switched to the Safety backup mode.

requirement: When the aircraft takes off and reaches the climb phase 1 with the landing gear in the down position, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to high level and simultaneously issue left and right brake signals (brake pressure is 50% FS).
safety_requirements: After power failure recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should automatically return to the normal working state, and re-validate the current flight phase and landing gear status to ensure the correctness of the landing gear retraction signal and brake pressure control. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should real-time check the current flight phase and landing gear status, and only trigger the high-level signal for retracting the landing gear and the 50%FS brake pressure output when it confirms that it is in the climb phase 1 and the landing gear is in the down position. The system should monitor the working status of the landing gear position sensor and external devices. When an abnormality in the sensor is detected or the device is in a power-off/initialization state, it should pause signal output and trigger a fault alarm to ensure Safety.

The system should strictly follow the predetermined timing and immediately output the high-level signal for landing gear retraction and the 50%FS brake pressure control command after the aircraft enters the climb phase 1 with the landing gear down. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should reassess the current flight phase and landing gear status after a power loss restart, and restore signal output based on the actual status to avoid control failure caused by unrecovered or incorrectly recovered status. Safety is critical in this process.

requirement: 1 second later, the system should check the retraction lock signal. If the retraction lock signal is at a low level, continue to check the landing gear retraction status.
safety_requirements: After a power loss and restart, the system should check and restore the process of retracting the locked signal after 1 second to ensure the correctness of state transition and subsequent operations. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should validate the level value of the retraction lock signal for effectiveness. When abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values are detected, the Safety handling mechanism should be triggered.

The system should ensure that the timing of the control logic is strictly synchronized with the hardware actions, and the trigger time for the signal check after 1 second must meet the predetermined timing requirements. Safety is critical in this process.

Before the system performs the retraction lock signal check, it should verify whether the current working phase and status meet the inspection conditions, so as to avoid incorrect operations due to unconsidered states or phases. Safety is crucial in this process.

After power failure recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should automatically detect and restore to the normal working state to ensure the integrity of the signal checking process after 1 second. Safety is crucial in this process.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the down position, the system should set the retract landing gear signal to a low level, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction fault flag. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to power loss of the software, it should check the landing gear status to ensure that the settings of the retract landing gear signal, left and right brake signals, and fault indicators are consistent with the current actual status. Safety is crucial in this process.

When the control calculation results are abnormal values or boundary values, the system should prohibit the erroneous setting of landing gear related signals and trigger the corresponding fault handling mechanism to ensure Safety.

The system should verify the validity of the control calculation results to ensure that the signals for landing gear retraction, braking, and fault flags are set as expected. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should implement an anti-false alarm mechanism for landing gear failure detection to ensure the accuracy of failure alarms, and real-time trigger the disposal process when a failure occurs. Safety is also a crucial concern in this process.

The system should verify the consistency between the current working status and the actual status of the landing gear when processing the landing gear control. If the statuses do not match, the signal setting operation shall be prohibited and the exception shall be recorded.

After power failure recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should automatically detect the current status of the landing gear and restore relevant signals and flags to a Safety state corresponding to the actual status.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the retracted state, the system should set the gear retraction signal to a low level and the left and right brake signals to 0.
safety_requirements: The system should check the calculation results of the landing gear status control, ensuring that under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, the processing results of setting the landing gear retraction signal to a low level and the left/right brake signals to 0 are correct and effective. Safety is critical in this process.

After the system restarts due to a power loss of the software, it should check the landing gear status control function to ensure that the settings for the retracting landing gear signal and the left and right brake signals have not been erroneously restored or not restored. The system should validate the inputs for the landing gear status control function, ensuring that the current working phase and status have been considered during processing to avoid signal setup errors caused by unconsidered statuses. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure that the execution sequence, timing, and hardware equipment coordination of the landing gear status control are consistent, and that the control conditions are complete and the logic is consistent before and after. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for the retraction control process of the landing gear. When the hardware status does not meet the control requirements for a long time, it triggers a warning or Safety protection measures.

requirement: If the retract lock signal is high, the system should periodically check the retract lock signal.

The system should detect the status of the output circuit in real time when periodically checking the retraction lock signal, to ensure normal signal transmission and no impact on other function outputs. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The timing and control logic for the system to perform the detection of the retraction lock signal should be synchronized with the hardware devices, ensuring that the control conditions are complete and the operation sequence complies with Safety requirements.

requirement: If the lock-up signal becomes low level within 1 minute, the system should set the gear-up signal to low level, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear status to retracted.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to a power failure, it should check the status of the landing gear and brake signals to ensure that they are consistent with the current actual status, and correctly perform the retraction or hold actions. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the retraction lock signal and other control parameters. When abnormal or boundary values are detected, the system should prohibit the execution of the gear retraction action and trigger the alarm mechanism to ensure Safety.

The system should check the interface data communication status when the software is powered off and restarted. If an interruption or inability to recover is detected, the current landing gear and brake signal status should remain unchanged, and safety protection measures should be implemented.

The system should set a timeout judgment for the action of retracting the landing gear. If the confirmation signal is not received within the specified time, the action should be terminated and a fault alarm should be triggered to ensure Safety.

After power failure recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should automatically detect the current status of the landing gear and brake systems, and restore to a Safety operable working condition.

requirement: If the lock-up signal remains high 1 minute later, the system should set the gear-up signal to low level, set the left and right braking signals to 0, and set the gear-up fault flag.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to a power loss of the software, it should check whether the current status has been restored correctly, ensuring that the settings for the gear-up signal, left and right brake signals, and the gear-up failure flag conform to the status logic before and after the restart, thus guaranteeing Safety.

The system should monitor the status of interface data communication. When an interruption or reconnection occurs, ensure that the output values of the gear-up signal, left and right brake signals, and fault indicators remain correct and consistent with the current system status to maintain Safety.

The system should handle the high-level sustained status of the retraction lock signal for anti-false alarm, ensuring that after detecting an effective fault signal, the operations of setting the retraction gear signal to low, setting the brake signal to 0, and setting the fault flag meet the real-time requirements. The system should verify the rationality of the control calculation results. When the retraction lock signal detection result is an abnormal value, boundary value, or extreme value, it shall prohibit incorrect actions such as setting the retraction landing gear signal low, clearing the brake signal to zero, and setting the fault flag. These actions must ensure Safety.

The system should perform a timeout monitoring of the duration of the retraction lock signal, ensuring that after the 1-minute timeout judgment is completed, the safety control process is enforced, which includes setting the retraction gear signal to low, setting the left and right brake signals to 0, and setting the fault flag. Safety

requirement: When the aircraft returns to the third side of the five-side route and the distance to the arrival point is less than 5000m, the system should set the left and right brakes to 100%, and the landing gear release signal should be set to high level.
safety_requirements: After power failure recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should return to the normal working state, ensuring that both brakes remain at 100% and the landing gear deployment signal is at a high level. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should validate the control calculation results to ensure that when the distance is less than 5000m, the left and right brakes are set to 100%, the landing gear release signal is high level, and the handling is correct for abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum and minimum values. Safety must always be prioritized in these procedures.

When the software restarts after a power loss, the system should check the status after the restart to ensure that the left and right brakes are still at 100% and the landing gear deployment signal remains at a high level, avoiding the situation where the status is not recovered or incorrectly recovered. The system should check the interface data of different redundancies. When a single or all redundancies fail, it still ensures that the left and right brakes are set to 100% and the landing gear signal is at a high level. Safety is guaranteed in this process.

The system should check the functional inputs to ensure that the brake and landing gear operations are correctly performed when on the third side of the five-edge approach and within 5000m, avoiding incorrect execution due to failure to consider the working phase or status. requirement: The system needs to calculate the value of yg using the formula based on the side offset Dz, the side offset speed Dz, and Δy. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the changes in side offset Dz, side offset speed Dz, and the rate of change of Δy, ensure they are within a reasonable range, and implement a clear processing strategy for data exceeding the slope. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should verify the coordination between the timing of control calculations for yg and hardware operations, ensuring that the control process sequence is orderly, conditions are complete, and there is consistency before and after. Safety must be considered throughout this process.

The system should conduct a classified check on the calculated yg values to ensure that the processing results under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and maximum/minimum value conditions meet expectations. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
The system should check if the accuracy of the interface data bit value is greater than the requirement and ensure the correctness of the output result when the accuracy exceeds the standard.

The system should check if the accuracy of the interface data bit value is lower than the requirement and ensure the correctness of the output result when the accuracy is insufficient. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

requirement: After 1s, the system should check the lock-down signal.
safety_requirements: The system should set a timeout judgment for the check of the lock signal. If the check is not completed within 1 second, an alarm should be triggered or it should enter the Safety state.

The system should ensure that the timing of the lock signal check is coordinated with the hardware control process, and all control conditions are complete and logically consistent. Safety is a priority.

After power failure recovery or reset due to runaway, the system should be able to return to normal operation and re-execute the check process for releasing the lock signal. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should check the current status after power failure and restart. If it finds that the status has not been restored or has been incorrectly restored, it should suspend operation and perform status calibration. Safety is crucial in this process.
The system should have a fault recovery mechanism for checking the drop lock signal, such as multiple retries or switching to a backup control path, and ensure its Safety.

requirement: If the gear-down lock signal is at a low level, it indicates a failure in the landing gear down circuit. Set the emergency gear-down signal to a high level. After one minute, set both the gear-down and emergency gear-down signals to a low level (in this case, the gear-down lock signal cannot be checked), and set the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset amounts. Set the landing gear down fault flag as valid. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to a software power-off, it should check the status of the landing gear fault flag and brake preset amount to ensure they are restored to the correct values before the fault occurred or take Safety disposal measures.

The system should ensure that the settings for landing gear deployment and emergency landing gear deployment signals, as well as the output of brake pre-setting, comply with the processing logic of the current fault status after interface data communication interruption or reconnection. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should have a false alarm prevention mechanism to conduct multi-condition verification on the low-level state of the lock release signal, avoiding the mis-triggering of emergency landing gear deployment signals due to interference, and ensuring that the response time for fault alarm triggering meets Safety time limit requirements.

The system should validate the effectiveness of the left and right brake pre-settings obtained from the control calculations, ensuring they are within the specified normal range. For abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, a protection mechanism should be triggered, and output should be prohibited. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should adopt a detection method that does not affect normal operations to monitor the放下 lock dead signal, and in cases where this signal cannot be checked (such as communication failures), ensure that the execution of emergency response procedures (such as brake pre-setting, fault flag setting) complies with safety logic.

requirement: If the gear-down lock signal is high, perform a periodic check of the gear-down lock signal: If the gear-down lock signal turns low within 1 minute, it indicates that the landing gear is down. Set the gear-down signal to low, set the landing gear status to down, set the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset values, and set the landing gear down fault flag as invalid.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to a power failure, it should check whether the landing gear status has returned to the correct state before the power failure to ensure the accuracy of the settings for the landing gear deployment signal, landing gear status, left and right brake presets, and fault indicators, thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should verify the interface data communication status when the software restarts after power loss. If communication interruption or reconnection is detected, it should re-validate the drop lock signal status and ensure the correctness of the landing gear control output Safety.

The system should validate the validity of the pre-set values for left and right braking calculations. When the calculation results show abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values, a protection mechanism should be triggered, and erroneous execution should be prohibited to ensure Safety.

The system should implement a false alarm prevention mechanism for the detection of the lock signal release, ensuring that the landing gear status is not mistakenly triggered to change under signal fluctuation or interference, and guaranteeing that the fault diagnosis response time meets real-time requirements. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system needs to conduct real-time comparison between the safety value and normal value of the interface data. When the difference between the safety value and the normal value exceeds the set threshold, it should prohibit automatic adjustment of the landing gear status and brake preset amount and trigger a safety alarm.

requirement: If the landing gear down lock signal is high, perform a periodic check on the down lock signal: if the signal remains high after 1 minute, it indicates a landing gear deployment failure. Then set the emergency landing gear down signal to high. After 1 second, periodically check the down lock signal again. Safety is critical in this process.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to power loss, it should check the current status and restore the periodic inspection process of the lock-up signal to ensure that the fault detection logic can still be correctly executed when the status after restart is not restored or incorrectly restored, thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should validate the duration and level status of the lock signal for effectiveness, ensuring that the control calculation results can correctly trigger the fault handling process under normal, abnormal, or boundary values. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should adopt an anti-false alarm mechanism to detect the continuous high-level state of the drop lock signal, ensuring that the fault detection logic will not be mistakenly triggered by instantaneous interference, and guaranteeing the real-time requirements for emergency signal output. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

After triggering the emergency landing gear deployment signal, the system should continuously monitor the status of the lock-down signal to ensure the periodic checks and fault handling procedures maintain continuity and timing accuracy after one second. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: If the lock signal remains high after 1 minute, it indicates that the emergency landing gear deployment has failed. Set both the landing gear deployment signal and the emergency landing gear deployment signal to low level. Set the left and right brakes to the corresponding preset values, and set the landing gear deployment fault flag to valid.
safety_requirements: After the system restarts due to a software power loss, it should check the status recovery of the emergency landing gear deployment function to ensure that the signals for deploying the landing gear and emergency deployment, the preset amounts for left and right brakes, and the output of the landing gear deployment fault indicator conform to the current system state. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should set up an anti-false alarm mechanism for fault detection in response to the failure of emergency landing gear release, and ensure that the fault alarm processing response time meets the real-time requirements. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

During the power-off reboot process of the software, the system should continuously monitor the status of interface data communication. When an interruption, reconnection, or inability to recover occurs, ensure the correctness of the signals related to landing gear deployment and brake preset values. Safety is a priority.

The system should perform a value range check on the pre-calculated left and right brake preset values to ensure that they can still correctly execute the brake settings and fault flag positioning operations under various conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values. Safety is also a concern during these operations.

The system should comprehensively cover the fault detection items of the emergency gear release function, including but not limited to key fault scenarios such as lock signal status, signal setting validity, brake execution status, etc. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: If the lock signal becomes low level within 1 minute, it indicates that the emergency release of the landing gear is successful. After a delay of 2 seconds, the signals for releasing the landing gear and emergency releasing the landing gear will both be set to low level. The landing gear status will be set as down, and the left and right brakes will be set to the corresponding preset values. The fault flag for landing gear release will be set as invalid.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the emergency release state of the landing gear has been restored when the software restarts after a power failure, ensuring that subsequent actions are stopped and the fault protection mechanism is triggered in cases where the state has not been restored or has been incorrectly restored. requirement: Remote control instructions can be issued to retract or extend the landing gear in any control mode as required.

requirement: When the "retract landing gear" remote control command is received, if the flight phase is not ground waiting and the flight altitude is not less than 80m, the processing in 1) of section 3.2.11.3 (excluding its conditions) shall be followed.

safety_requirements: The system should check the working status of different redundancies. When two or more redundancies are in different states, it should ensure that the adoption of left and right brake control quantities meets the requirements of the current working status, thus ensuring Safety.

The system should check the results of the control calculations (including normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values) to ensure the correct adoption of left and right brake control quantities under different numerical conditions, thereby ensuring Safety.

The system should check the same input data received by different redundancies. When the same input data received by two or more redundancies have inconsistent values, it ensures the correctness of functional processing and Safety.
