After the software restarts due to power loss, the system should check if it is in the landing rollout phase state to ensure that the subsequent control logic can still be correctly executed when the state is not restored or incorrectly restored. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should check the input values of the landing gear full compression signal and remote control grounding signal to ensure that the processing of entering the landing run segment is correct under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum and minimum values. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should perform anti-false alarm processing for fault detection of the landing gear full compression signal or remote control grounding signal, and ensure that the anti-false alarm processing does not affect the real-time requirements for alarm processing. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should set a timeout judgment for the trigger conditions of the landing gear full compression signal or remote control grounding signal, ensuring that the hardware status meets the control requirements within a reasonable time and avoiding long-term abnormalities. This is to ensure Safety.

requirement: Item d needs to be judged only once, and for other items, the phase transition must meet the corresponding conditions continuously for 5 times before it can proceed. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the correctness of phase transition conditions (such as meeting other items consecutively 5 times or meeting item d once) when switching state priorities, to ensure that high/low priority switching does not affect the condition judgment logic. Safety is still guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should check the logical judgment conditions for phase transition, avoid the occurrence of 'logically always false', 'logically always true' or 'condition error', and ensure the correct execution of the judgment logic that other items need to meet the conditions for 5 consecutive times. This ensures the Safety of the system operation under all circumstances.

The system should perform an integrity check on the logical branches for phase transition to prevent abnormal execution of conditional judgment logic between item d and other items caused by 'omitted logical branches'. Safety.

When the system performs phase conversion, it should confirm that the input parameters have considered the current working phase and status, avoiding condition judgment errors caused by 'not considering the working phase/status'. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should verify the results of phase transition control calculations to ensure that under conditions such as 'normal value', 'abnormal value', and 'boundary value', the logic for judging phase transition conditions is handled correctly. Safety must also be considered during this process.

The system should monitor the duration of phase transition judgment. If the task duration exceeds the specified time limit, a warning should be triggered and the current phase status should remain unchanged. Safety is crucial in this process.

requirement: If the phase marker is "falling", then no phase transition will be performed.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that when the phase marker is "falling", any state transition is prohibited, and the unsatisfiability of state transition conditions should be verified in real time. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

The system should conduct mandatory checks on the transfer conditions between each pair of states. The system should perform real-time verification of the control calculation results to ensure that Md2(k) outputs within the range of [-XfSita, XfSita] under various conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, and triggers the amplitude limiting protection mechanism when exceeding the limit. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should compare the Md2(k) output data of different redundancies. When the difference between two or more redundant output data exceeds the specified threshold, redundant processing should be performed and the abnormality should be recorded.

The system should conduct status and operation phase validity checks on the functional inputs to ensure that the calculation process of Md2(k) strictly matches the requirements of the current working status and phase. Safety is a critical concern throughout this process.

requirement: Md3(k) = Khd . [h(k) - hg(k)] + Md2(k), Md3(k) amplitude limit [-XfSita, XfSita]
safety_requirements: The system should continuously verify whether the output value of the control calculation result Md3(k) is within the limit range [-XfSita, XfSita], and trigger alarms or apply restrictions for abnormal values, boundary values, and outputs exceeding the limit. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should perform real-time detection of the data bit value accuracy of the input interface data h(k), hg(k), and Md2(k). When the detected accuracy is lower than the required level, the system should automatically terminate the calculation and record the abnormality.

The system should perform precision adaptation processing on input data when the accuracy of the data bit value exceeds the specified requirements to ensure the validity of the calculation results. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system must validate the legality of functional inputs based on the current working status and phase parameters. Inputs that do not match the status/phase parameters should be rejected and trigger a status exception signal. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should verify the length of the data frame received by the communication interface. When it detects that the data length is beyond the [minimum length, maximum length] range, it should terminate data processing and activate the communication error mechanism.

requirement: When the flight altitude is no more than 150m, the phase transition processing is carried out according to the current stage marker and the status information such as the current flight altitude and airspeed.
safety_requirements: The system should check the priority of multiple functions during phase transition to ensure that the conversion results of status and functions are correct when high priority switches to low priority or low priority switches to high priority.

When the system transfers its state at a flight altitude of ≤150m, it should verify the correctness of the output after the change in the functional interface data value or the change in the value range to ensure the accuracy of the phase transition processing results. Safety is also ensured during this process.

The system needs to verify the transfer conditions between each pair of states, avoiding phase transition errors caused by transfer conditions being unset, always satisfied, or unsatisfiable. Safety is ensured through this process.

The system should check the communication protocol of the interface data frame to ensure that the data length is within the specified range, preventing phase transition errors caused by abnormal data length. This ensures Safety.

The system should check the functional inputs to ensure that the current working phase and status have been considered during the transition of processing stages, avoiding processing errors caused by failure to consider them. Safety is a critical concern throughout this process.

requirement: Jg(k) = -Md3(k)
safety_requirements: The system should perform real-time monitoring of the accuracy of interface data bit values. When the detected data bit value accuracy is less than required, it should ensure the correctness of the Jg(k) = -Md3(k) calculation result and trigger an accuracy insufficiency alarm. Safety must be considered throughout this process.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the precision of interface data bit values. When the detected data bit value precision is greater than the requirement, it should ensure the correctness of the Jg(k) = -Md3(k) calculation result and record the redundant precision data while ensuring Safety.

The system should continuously monitor the input data cycle. When the input value cycle is greater than the specified cycle, less than the specified cycle, or reaches an extreme maximum or minimum value, it should ensure the integrity of the Jg(k) = -Md3(k) calculation process and the correctness of the output results. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

The system should validate the effectiveness of the control calculation results. When the calculation result of Jg(k) = -Md3(k) produces abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values, an exception handling mechanism should be initiated and the system should maintain a Safety state.

During the execution of data processing for Jg(k) = -Md3(k), the system should implement protective measures against division by zero, ensuring that the denominator is not zero and has the capability to automatically handle division-by-zero errors, thus guaranteeing Safety.

requirement: When |DH| > 50m, the flight phase transitions from the constant altitude segment to the climb 2 or descent segment.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the rate of change of the DH parameters to ensure that it is within the preset upper and lower limits of the slope range, and execute a predefined superslope processing strategy when it exceeds the range. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should clearly define the collection range of the DH sensor (upper and lower limits). When the sensor data is detected to be out of range, the sensor fault alarm mechanism should be triggered immediately.

When the system transitions from the altitude-holding phase to the climb or descent phase during flight, it should check the values and range changes of functional interface data to ensure that the rudder deflection angle calculation and flight control output after the state transition are consistent with the target state. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should establish priority rules for flight phase transitions. When there are multiple switchable states, high-priority functions should be executed first, and the correctness of states and functions during high/low priority switching should be verified. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should verify the communication protocol of the interface data frame to ensure that the data length meets the specified requirements. When abnormal data length (greater than or less than the specified length) is detected, error handling measures should be taken and the abnormal event should be recorded to ensure Safety.

requirement: Md2(k) = Kp1I . Md1(k), Md2(k) amplitude limit [Xf, Xfx]
safety_requirements: The system should check the precision of the interface data bit values. When the precision is greater than required, ensure that the calculation of Md2(k) and its amplitude limiting processing result satisfy the formula Md2(k) = Kp1I·Md1(k) and are confined within the range [Xf, Xfx].

The system should check the precision of the interface data bit values. When the precision is less than required, ensure that the calculation of Md2(k) and its amplitude limitation processing meet the formula Md2(k) = Kp1I·Md1(k) and are confined within the range [Xf, Xfx].

The system should verify the results of the control calculations (normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values) to ensure that the calculation and amplitude limiting processing results of Md2(k) meet expectations, and trigger a warning mechanism in abnormal situations to ensure Safety.

The system should verify whether the functional inputs take into account the current working phase and status, ensuring that the calculation of Md2(k) and the results of amplitude limitation processing are consistent with the requirements of the working phase and status. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should detect frame loss during the data frame communication process and take fault-tolerant measures when frame loss occurs to ensure the Safety and reliability of the calculation of Md2(k) and the results of the amplitude limiting processing.

requirement: The situation during flight on the five-sided route, longitudinally: both the upper and lower underlined parts are limited to the range [-XfSita, XfSita].
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the working status of different redundancies. When two or more redundancies are detected to be in different statuses, it shall ensure the accuracy of the limit calculation result of the longitudinal rudder deflection angle on the five-side route and trigger a status abnormality alarm. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should validate the range of longitudinal flight data collected by the sensors. When the data exceeds the preset range [-XfSita, XfSita], immediately report a sensor failure and stop related control outputs. This ensures Safety.

The system should continuously monitor the continuous output data of longitudinal rudder angles at different redundancies. When a difference exceeding the preset threshold is detected, the output should be paused and switch to safety mode.

The system should verify the consistency of the same input data received from different redundancies. When inconsistent input data is detected, the system should stop calculation and trigger the fault diagnosis mechanism to ensure that all redundancies are processed based on the same input. Safety is ensured throughout this process.

requirement: The system should be able to calculate and provide the speed resolution relationship for a flight altitude of 200m on a five-sided approach.
safety_requirements: The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the speed calculation results at a flight altitude of 200m on the five-sided approach, ensuring the correctness of the calculation relationships under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme minimum/maximum values, and triggering corresponding processing mechanisms. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

The system should set a response timeout threshold for the speed calculation process. If the calculation is not completed within the specified time, the process will be terminated and a backup strategy will be activated to ensure Safety.

The system should monitor the rate of change of speed calculation parameters. When detecting that it exceeds the preset upper and lower limits of the slope, it automatically intercepts abnormal data and records the event to ensure Safety.

The system should verify the compatibility of input parameters with the logic for calculating the final approach path based on the current flight phase and status indicators, and prohibit illegal calculation requests across phases/states. Safety is ensured through this process.

The system should connect to an external environmental monitoring interface. When abnormal conditions such as high sea state or severe weather are detected, it should automatically enter the speed calculation Safety mode and implement risk management.

requirement: The system should be able to achieve lateral control, the same as segment 2 of the climb.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the timing and sequence of lateral directional control are coordinated with the hardware, the control conditions are complete and consistent with the logic of climb segment 2. Safety is also a critical factor to consider in this process.

The system should verify the timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships of each functional point in the lateral control logic to ensure they are correct. Safety is a critical concern throughout this process.

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for critical controls or actions, and terminate the execution and trigger an alarm when the hardware status does not meet the control requirements for a long time. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

After the system executes lateral control, it should continuously monitor the consistency between the actual hardware status and the control requirements. When the status is inconsistent, the exception handling process shall be initiated to ensure Safety.

The system should strictly output the lateral control status according to the timing required by the current scene, ensuring synchronization with the flight phase and mission requirements, thereby ensuring Safety.

requirement: The system should be able to achieve throttle airspeed closed-loop control, where the specified airspeed ug is calculated based on the aircraft's flight performance. Refer to the appendix for data regarding the final approach flying speed.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the execution order, timing, and hardware of the throttle airspeed closed-loop control are coordinated. The control conditions must be complete and the status before and after should remain consistent. Safety is a priority.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the calculation results of the idle air flow closed-loop control. When abnormal values, boundary values, or maximum/minimum values occur, a warning should be triggered and the correct execution of the control logic should be ensured. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should validate the validity of the given airspeed ug at different working stages and flight conditions to ensure that the impact of stage and status parameters on the control process is not ignored Safety is a priority.

The system needs to verify the correctness of the timing relationships, constraint relationships, and concurrent logic between the throttle airspeed closed-loop control and other functional points, avoiding timing conflicts or deadlock phenomena. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should perform integrity checks on data such as boundary value combinations and initial value combinations of the preceding function outputs, ensuring they meet the input requirements for throttle airspeed closed-loop control, and block subsequent function execution in case of abnormalities. Safety is a priority.

requirement: The system should be able to perform discretization calculations, including the calculations of Md2(k), Md3(k), and Jg(k), and carry out amplitude limiting on Md2(k) and Md3(k).
safety_requirements: The system should check the control calculation results of Md2(k), Md3(k), and Jg(k) to ensure that they are processed correctly under normal, abnormal, boundary, and extreme minimum/maximum value conditions, and verify the amplitude limiting results of Md2(k) and Md3(k).

The system should check the consistency of the values of discrete output data with different redundancies (such as Md2(k) and Md3(k)). When data inconsistency occurs, the redundancy management mechanism should be triggered to ensure functional correctness and Safety.

The system should validate the status and working phase of the functional inputs to ensure that, when the current working status or phase is not considered, it either rejects processing or takes Safety measures.

The system should perform validity checks on the data bits with discrete value ranges in the input interface to ensure that their values are enumerated values within the valid value range; otherwise, it should reject processing or trigger an exception mechanism. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system should perform outlier detection on data bits with discrete value ranges in the input interface. When an undefined value outside the valid range is detected, it should either reject processing or trigger an exception mechanism to ensure Safety.

requirement: The system should be able to achieve longitudinal control during the descent phase, the same as Segment 1 of the climb, wherein the given airspeed ug is calculated from the aircraft's flight performance, and boundary points are subject to amplitude limitation.
safety_requirements: During the longitudinal control process in the descent phase, the system should conduct real-time detection of the current working phase and status, validate the validity of input parameters (including the given airspeed ug), and ensure that the control calculation logic matches the current flight phase (descent/climb phase) to guarantee Safety.

The system should perform synchronous verification of the timing sequence for longitudinal control calculations with the hardware execution timing sequence to ensure that the order of control command output, duration, and trigger conditions comply with the requirements of the hardware interface specifications.

The system should establish a multi-dimensional verification mechanism for controlling the solution results, to conduct full coverage validation of normal/abnormal/boundary values for the calculated value of airspeed ug and the output value after boundary point limiting, and activate the Safety degradation strategy when an invalid value is detected.

The system needs to establish a timing constraint model for the control logic of functional points, to verify the correct coordination relationship between descent phase longitudinal control and other control functions (such as climb phase control) in terms of timing, data dependency, and resource occupation. Safety is a crucial consideration throughout this process.

The system should be configured with a timing monitoring module for output control status to ensure that the switching of longitudinal control status strictly synchronizes with the flight phase transition signal and altitude/speed threshold values. It should also trigger an alarm when the timing deviation exceeds the threshold. Safety is critical in this process.

requirement: The system should be able to achieve lateral control during the descent phase, the same as segment 2 of the climb.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the execution order, timing, and hardware coordination of the lateral control during the descent phase. The control conditions should be complete and consistent before and after, and should be consistent with the control requirements of the climb phase 2.

The system should check the input for the lateral control of the descent phase to ensure the correctness of function processing without considering the current working phase or status, and it should be consistent with the requirements of climb phase 2.

The system should verify the correctness of the timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships between the lateral control during the descent phase and other functional points, and maintain consistency with the control logic of the climb phase. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

The system should check the calculation results of the lateral control during the descending phase to ensure that the function processing is correct under various conditions such as normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme minimum/maximum values, and it should be consistent with the requirements of climb phase 2. Safety must also be ensured throughout this process.

The system should check the working status of each redundancy to ensure the correctness of lateral control function implementation during the descent phase when two or more redundancies are in different states, and meet the control requirements for climb phase 2. Safety must be guaranteed throughout this process.

requirement: During the phase transition processing in the non-remote control mode, there may be a series of phase transitions until the flight phase adapted to the current state is reached.
safety_requirements: During the phase transition processing of non-remote control mode, the system should check whether the functional inputs take into account the current working phase and status to ensure that the control calculation process matches the actual status. Safety is also a key concern in this process.

The system should set up a timeout detection mechanism for key controls or actions during the phase transition of non-remote control mode. When the hardware status does not meet the control requirements for a long time, the warning or switching mechanism will be triggered. Safety is an important consideration in this process.

When the system transfers from one working state to another, it should check the values and value range changes of the functional interface data to ensure the correctness of the output results such as rudder angle calculation during the phase transition process. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should verify the control calculation results during the phase transition of non-remote control mode, ensure that they are valid normal values, and trigger corresponding processing mechanisms for abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme maximum/minimum values.

The system should ensure that the switching of functions with different priorities conforms to the predetermined logic under multiple states with transfer relationships, and maintain the correctness of state and function processing when high priority switches to low priority or low priority switches to high priority. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

requirement: The system should be able to implement fixed throttle control, limiting the throttle according to the minimum throttle amplitude value, which can be modified through a throttle fine-tuning amount. The default values should be provided for altitudes of 5000, 6000, 7000, and 8000 meters, with intermediate values processed by linear interpolation. Above 5000 meters during descent, the modification amount is [-10%.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the timing and sequence of the fixed vane control are coordinated with the hardware, and the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety is also a key factor to consider in this process.

The system should check the calculation results of the fixed vane control to ensure correct processing in cases of normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, maximum and minimum values, etc., to guarantee Safety.

The system should clearly define the upper and lower limits of the sensor's collection range, and trigger a sensor fault alarm when the collected value exceeds the range. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
The system should check the input of the fixed vane control under different working conditions and phases to ensure that the processing logic takes into account the current working status and phase.
The system should set reasonable fault detection logic to ensure that the fault detection method does not affect the normal operation of the equipment. Safety is a priority in this process.

requirement: Flight phase determination function requirements: Automatically determine the current flight phase based on the aircraft's position information and motion parameter information. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.
safety_requirements: The system should check the input location information and motion parameters to ensure that the flight phase determination function can still correctly process the input data without considering the working phase or working status. Safety is a crucial aspect in this process.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the input data values in the task execution conditions to prevent the task execution conditions from being met prematurely due to abnormal input data, thereby ensuring the accuracy of the flight phase determination and Safety.

The system should verify the consistency of system status, operation phase, and software status to ensure that the flight phase determination function can still be correctly executed when there is no corresponding software status or inconsistency between software and system. Safety is a priority in this process.

The system should continuously validate the input data values in the task execution conditions to prevent delays in meeting the task execution conditions caused by abnormal input data, thereby ensuring the timeliness and accuracy of determining the flight phase. Safety is a crucial consideration throughout this process.

The system should monitor the working status of external devices such as sensors, NVM, databases, etc. When it detects that a device is in degraded or maintenance mode, corresponding measures should be taken to ensure the correctness of the output of the flight phase determination function. Safety is crucial in this process.

requirement: Ground waiting phase: Before takeoff and after complete landing, the aircraft is in a stationary state.
safety_requirements: The system should check whether the entry conditions for the ground waiting phase are met, ensure correct entry into the parking state when the conditions are met, and maintain or exit the state when the conditions change. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should prevent the simultaneous activation of other states without transfer relationships during the ground waiting phase, ensuring the mutual exclusiveness of state execution. Safety is a critical consideration in this process.

After the system restarts due to a power loss, it should automatically recover to the correct state of the ground waiting phase and verify the validity of the state. If the recovery is abnormal, the Safety protection mechanism will be triggered.

The system should monitor the operating status of external devices such as sensors and NVM. When the device is in an abnormal state such as power-off or initialization, it is prohibited to perform function operations unrelated to the ground waiting phase. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

The system must verify that it is currently in the ground waiting phase when processing control inputs, and it is prohibited to perform function calculations under non-shutdown conditions without considering the working phase or status. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

requirement: Takeoff ground segment (takeoff run segment): Control the lateral deviation and yaw angle of the aircraft relative to the runway centerline through differential braking and rudder deflection, and control the aircraft longitudinally according to the given pitch angle.
safety_requirements: The system should check the functional inputs to ensure that during the control calculation process in the take-off ground segment (take-off run segment), the current working stage and status are fully considered, avoiding control errors caused by not considering the working stage or status. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

The system should verify the control calculation results (differential braking instructions and rudder deflection angles) to ensure they can be correctly executed under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme minimum/maximum values, and appropriate measures should be taken. Safety is crucial in this process.

The system should ensure that the execution sequence and timing of the left-right differential brakes and rudder control are coordinated with the hardware devices, and that the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after, to prevent control failure caused by timing errors or inconsistent conditions. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should continuously monitor the working status of each redundancy. If it detects that two or more redundancies are in different states, it should trigger the status synchronization mechanism or enter Safety mode to ensure functional correctness.

requirement: Takeoff departure phase: from reaching a certain altitude and airspeed to the Safety height, mainly control the aircraft to climb at a certain pitch angle.
safety_requirements: When the system switches between different working phases and states, it should check the input parameters of the take-off departure control function to ensure that the control calculations can still be executed correctly even if the working phase or state is not considered. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

The system should verify the calculation results of the pitch angle for take-off departure control, ensuring that the control outputs meet the safety flight requirements under normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values.

The system should monitor in real time the conditions for entering the take-off departure phase to ensure that the status control logic is correctly executed/terminated when the conditions are met/not met/met again. Safety

The system should set up a control calculation timeout monitoring mechanism. When the pitch angle calculation is not completed within the specified time, it should trigger redundant switching or alarm mechanism to ensure Safety.

The system should conduct synchronous checks on the working status of redundant channels. When inconsistency in status between redundancies is detected, it should suspend control output and execute the status calibration procedure. Safety is a crucial consideration in this process.

requirement: Climb Segment 1: The phase from the safety altitude (80m) to the flaps being retracted, mainly involves controlling the aircraft to continue climbing, longitudinally transitioning to airspeed control, and sequentially retracting the landing gear and flaps.
safety_requirements: The system should check the current working phase and flight status to ensure that the control calculations during the climb phase 1 are based on the correct phase and status information.

The system should conduct real-time verification of the conditions for entering the climb phase 1 (such as altitude 80m) and ensure that the status execution meets expectations when the conditions are met, not met, or met again.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the control calculation results (such as airspeed, flap position) to ensure they are within normal and Safety ranges, and trigger warning or limitation mechanisms when abnormal values, boundary values, or extreme values appear.

The system should correctly handle the priority switching with other states or functions, and ensure that the exit of the climbing state and the entry into the new state during the high/low priority switching comply with the safety logic.

When the system transfers from one working state to another, it should verify the changes in the values of functional interface data to ensure that the output control instructions (such as flap and landing gear retraction sequence) remain accurate and error-free under data changes. Safety is a crucial concern throughout this process.

requirement: Climb phase 2: From flap retraction to reaching the required cruise altitude, or from one altitude to a higher altitude, longitudinal control is according to the given airspeed, and lateral control guides the aircraft along the pre-programmed route.
safety_requirements: When the system performs 2-stage climb control in different working phases, it should verify whether the input data meets the requirements of the current working phase and status, ensuring the accuracy of longitudinal airspeed control and lateral route tracking calculations. Safety must always be considered during these processes.

The system should conduct real-time comparison of the redundancy data for longitudinal airspeed control output and lateral route tracking control. When the difference between the two redundancy outputs exceeds the threshold, an abnormality handling mechanism should be triggered. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should verify the validity of the data output from the preceding function to the vertical airspeed control and lateral route tracking module. When the input data is in an abnormal equivalence class, subsequent calculations should be terminated and the fault should be recorded to ensure Safety.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of the working status of different redundancies. When inconsistency in the working status between redundancies is detected, status synchronization should be initiated or the primary redundancy should be switched.

During the climb process from flaps retracted to cruise altitude, the system should continuously monitor the margin consistency of flight altitude and airspeed parameters to ensure that the control command output meets the requirements of the Safety flight envelope.

requirement: Fixed-height phase: longitudinally control the aircraft's altitude and airspeed, and laterally perform side deviation control, so that the aircraft flies at the required altitude and airspeed.
safety_requirements: The system should verify whether the functional inputs consider the current working stage and status during the fixed height phase to ensure that the calculation process of longitudinal altitude/airspeed control and lateral side bias control is consistent with the actual status. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.

The system should conduct real-time verification of the control calculation results during the altitude-holding phase (including normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values) to ensure that the outputs of longitudinal altitude/airspeed and lateral side deviation meet the Safety flight requirements.

The system should ensure that the control instruction sequence, timing, and hardware execution are coordinated during the altitude-fixing phase, and verify the completeness of control conditions and the logical consistency. Safety

The system should set up a timeout detection mechanism for the control calculation process during the fixed-height phase. If the calculation is not completed within the specified time, it should trigger a Safety degradation or alarm mechanism.

The system should monitor the working status of different redundancies. When two or more redundancies are detected to be in an inconsistent state, the height control phase should be paused and the redundant status synchronization or switching process should be executed. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

requirement: When descending below 5000 meters, the throttle limit is no less than 6%, and the change amount is [-6.5%, 10%].
safety_requirements: The system should clearly define the upper and lower limits of the throttle valve parameters collected by the sensor, and trigger a sensor fault alarm when the collected value exceeds the range. Safety is an important consideration in this process.

The system should set the upper and lower limits of the slope for the parameter changes of the throttle valve (-6.5% to 10%), and implement data truncation or alarm processing for data exceeding the slope range.

The system should ensure that the valid value range of the throttle limiter parameter is no less than 6%. It should also enforce safety limits on values below the lower limit and record abnormalities.

The system should implement over-limit protection for the throttle limiter data to be output. When the calculated value exceeds the allowable range, it should be truncated or a preset Safety value should be output according to the Safety strategy.

The system should continuously check the throttle control calculation results, validate the normal values, abnormal values, boundary values, and extreme maximum/minimum values, and initiate the protection mechanism when abnormalities are detected to ensure Safety.

requirement: When the aircraft crosses the 5000m altitude, the throttle fine-tuning amount will be linearly reduced to zero at a speed of 5%/s.
safety_requirements: The system should detect whether there is any division by zero operation when calculating the fine adjustment amount of the throttle valve, to ensure that the data processing will not fail due to division by zero.

The system should limit the collection range of the height sensor, and immediately trigger a sensor fault alarm when the actual height exceeds the threshold range of 5000 meters. Safety is crucial in this process.

After power failure recovery or runaway reset, the system should automatically restore the throttle control function to a Safety state and ensure that it can continue to execute the throttle adjustment commands during altitude crossing.

When the output value of the throttle valve fine-tuning exceeds the preset limit, the system should handle it according to the truncation or predefined Safety value strategy, and record the abnormal event.

The system should evaluate the impact of filtering processing on the real-time performance of the throttle adjustment, ensuring that the response time of the linear decrement control at 5%/s meets the flight Safety requirements.

requirement: When the aircraft has entered the glide phase, perform phase transition processing based on the current flight status. Safety is critical during this process.
safety_requirements: When the system transfers from one working state to another, it should check the changes in the values or ranges of functional interface data to ensure the correctness of the output during the phase transition processing. Safety is also a crucial concern during this process.

The system should check the switching logic between high-priority and low-priority functions to ensure the correctness of state transition and function processing. Safety is also a critical concern in this process.

When the system transfers its state, if the value of the functional interface data does not change, it is still necessary to ensure the accuracy of the output in the phase transition processing. Safety must be considered in this process.
The system should continuously check the entry conditions of the state, and ensure the correct execution of phase transition processing when the conditions are met, not met, or met again.

The system should verify whether the functional inputs take into account the current working phase and status, avoiding phase transition processing errors caused by failure to consider them. Safety is also a crucial factor in this process.

requirement: The longitudinal control of the 1-segment approach is the same as the height fixing on the fifth side, and the given height refers to the glide path processing section in the sixth volume.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the rate of change of the height parameter for the longitudinal control of segment 1 of the glide path, ensuring it remains within the preset upper and lower limits of the slope range, and implement predefined processing strategies for data exceeding the slope. Safety is critical in this process.

The system should set a clear valid value range for the height parameter of the longitudinal control in the 1 segment response to slide, and trigger corresponding processing strategies for out-of-limit data. Safety is also an important consideration in this process.

The system should ensure that the execution sequence and timing of the glide path 1 segment vertical control are coordinated with the hardware system, and that the control conditions are complete and free of contradictions. Safety must be a priority in this process.

The system should verify the timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships between the glide path longitudinal control of segment 1 and other functional points to ensure they are correct without errors. Safety must be considered in this process.

During the process of 1 segment longitudinal control, the system should check the height parameter inputs for working phase and status to ensure that the control calculation logic takes into account the effects of the current working phase and status, thereby enhancing Safety.

requirement: The lateral control during descent segment 1 is the same as climb segment 2.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the timing sequence and hardware coordination of the lateral control for segment 1 descent and segment 2 climb, ensuring that the control conditions are complete and consistent before and after. Safety must be ensured throughout this process.
The system should ensure that the entry and exit conditions of the lateral control modes for descent segment 1 and climb segment 2 are consistent. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should conduct phase-related checks on the input of the control functions for 1 segment descent and 2 segments climb, ensuring that the control logic can still be correctly processed even when the working phase/working status is not considered. Safety is a crucial factor in this process.

The system should verify that the timing, constraint, concurrency, and combination relationships between the lateral control functions of descent phase 1 and climb phase 2 conform to the design requirements. Safety is also a critical factor in this process.

The system should clearly define the reasonable range of the change rate of lateral control parameters (upper and lower limits of slope), and have a clear processing strategy and response mechanism for data with excessive slope.

requirement: The closed-loop control formula for the wind speed of the 1-section downslide spoiler is δp = Kp (vg - vk), with δp limited to [12.5%, 100%]. The given airspeed can be found in the appendix under downslide speed.
safety_requirements: The system should check the current working stage and status before control calculation, ensuring that the input parameters of the throttle airspeed closed-loop control formula δp = Kp(vg - vk) meet the requirements of the working stage and status, and stop the calculation when there is a mismatch. Safety is also a key consideration in this process.

requirement: If the flight altitude is greater than the decision altitude (40m), then control the aircraft to enter the go-around procedure.
safety_requirements: After power failure recovery or runaway reset, the system should automatically detect the flight status and return to a safe working mode to ensure the integrity and correctness of the re-flight program control logic. Safety

The system should set up a timeout judgment mechanism for the initiation of the go-around procedure. If the go-around conditions are not met or an execution exception occurs within the preset time, then the output of dangerous instructions should be stopped and an alarm triggered. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should real-time verify the rationality of flight altitude and equipment status before issuing go-around control instructions. Instructions shall not be issued when abnormal altitude data is detected or the equipment is unable to execute the command. Safety is a crucial concern in this process.

The system should have a clear fault recovery mechanism. When a fault in the go-around control link is detected, it should switch to the safety backup mode and record the fault details for post-event analysis.

The system should conduct real-time monitoring of abnormal external environments such as high sea conditions and severe weather, and automatically adjust the logic of the re-flight procedure or restrict the output of related control commands when environmental parameters exceed limits, to ensure Safety.
